name: Capitol Market
reviews:
Welcoming and clean. I always enter on the far end and stroll my way through. They have such a variety of foods. The cheese selection is one of the best in the country and they offer suggestions of pairing with an amazing array of wines from all over the world. The fresh meat and fish are spectacular....and if you want to just sit and have coffee and people watch this is a great spot. SoHo is an amazing restaurant and the frittata is massive and delicious. The wait staff delightful and the manager, William a gem. 

Everytime I am in Charleston this place is on my MUST GO places. It should be your also. PS right across the street diagonally is an amazin Bread Store too with gluten free options that rock.

The capitol market is a lovely place to buy locally grown food and other plants. I would definitely recommend visiting! The vendors are lovely and the selection is large. It’s a nice place to walk around even if you don’t plan on purchasing anything. My only complaint is that parking can be an issue depending on the season. Otherwise 10/10 would recommend! :)

Friendly family type atmosphere.  Great food.  You have to try the fish dinners!!!   They have everything.  Lots of West Virginia crafts including books and locally grown produce.  If you go you will love it and will go back.
Love shopping here. All the indoor and outdoor shops and vendors are super friendly and helpful. They will literally take the time to help you find exactly what you are looking for.

I loved this market. It is definitely a diamond in the rough. It is bright,fresh,clean,and busy. I started with getting a salad from the purple onion and I also purchased the best honey crisp apples ever, I then went to Mecca Coffee and Holls chocolate. The people were all so polite and helpful with the exception of the sales employee at Holls. Their chocolates were amazing so it made up for a rude employee. This market also sell wine,fresh,fruits and veggies,houses a restaurant,sells fresh cute meat,seafood,and sushi. I will definitely come back during my monthly business visit.
Enjoy the photos!

name: West Virginia State Museum
address: 1900 Kanawha Blvd E #435, Charleston, WV 25305, USA
reviews: Amazing museum that tells West Virginia's history in a creative and fun way. Following the timeline and seeing the scenery change as you walk through was really fascinating. On top of that, there are areas with artifacts that you can step off the timeline and view. I do wish that the artifact rooms didn't make you jump past parts of the time lines at times and that there was a way to reset the speaking, as sometimes you'd trip the sensor for the next part before you were done with the last one.

Incredible museum showcasing the amazing history of West Virginia. The quality of displays and artifacts is outstanding, especially considering the admission is free! You could spend hours upon hours walking this museum and still not see everything. You can tell they really care about the museum and have put a lot of time and effort into it. Quite an exceptional place.

This museum has a great collection of exhibits with an interactive walk through format. Be sure to make time for the various short films and interactive programs in each exhibit that flesh out the history represented by the objects in the cases. Kids have a chance to get more involved by completing a scavenger hunt!

I visited the Genealogy library at the Cultural Center.  They have an excellent array of vital documents, wills, newspapers, land records. Etc plus reference materials. Watch out for the parking police!

I took my teenaged son to the museum while we were in the area to visit my father over Christmas. We were both overwhelmed by the attention to detail everywhere we looked within multiple VAST displays of West Virginia history! Before arriving, I was seriously expecting a long boring walk highlighting the finer points of the coal industry (no offense). But this place completely blew me away! The museum does feature several displays on the history of coal mining, it's a rich part of the state's heritage, but the presentation goes exceedingly beyond mere coal. Featuring civil war relics, the humble beginnings of the emancipation proclamation, President Lincoln, Daniel Boon, Byrd, Yeager, the state police, crafts, all the way back to geological specimens AND MUCH MORE (including a robot). Stop by if you're curious and in the area, expect to spend a couple hours. My son and I both want to go back so we have more time.

name: Heritage Towers
address: 612 Virginia St E, Charleston, WV 25301, USA

name: Criel Mound
reviews:
Criel Mound in South Charleston WV is a Sacred Burial Site  where the Indians were laid to rest in this mound formation.
Many people visit this historical site to see this amazing structure and read the provided information about it.
There is stairs that go up to the top to get a scenic overlook and a bench to sit on to rest or take pictures.
This is a unique place to visit and even have a afternoon 🧺 picnic.

Love discovering ancient earthworks and burial mounds. Should not have brought the child... she spilled a bag of Doritos all over the top of the burial mound, we cleaned it all up but I am now waiting to see if she is haunted.

It is amazing to interact with a pre-historic monument right in the center of South Charleston. I am sad that so much the great ceremonial mound village in Dunbar and South Charleston is now lost to us. Take care and honor the aspects of it that are left.

It certainly is an ancient burial mound. Definitely a cool visit if you're already in the area for the purpose of experiencing history, but its closeness to modern things like Dollar General I find a bit jarring.

Great information explaining about the Criel Mound around the site. My issue is all the litter that was on the grounds. You can visit this site in less than thirty minutes.  I learned a lot about these native Americans and their way of life in this region.

name: Magic Island Park
reviews: Beautiful place for kids to play. Splash park is awesome. They have shade umbrellas. Nice walk by the river. They only had the mens bathroom unlocked but it was very clean.
Nice place to sit and gather your thoughts
Nice place to walk,run,or just relax and let the kids have FUN!! FREEEEE (Because EVERYONE likes FREE)✌️❤️🧘🏃👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 FOR ALL AGES 👏👏
This is our go to place for flying kites! We love flying kites and it's the perfect spot because of the wind and open space. We can also take a break and swing in the swings or use the splash pad.
Me and my love would go there all the time to walk, throw frisky, and hang out. It was such a nice place!!

name: Locked and Coded Escape Rooms LLC
address: 222 Kanawha Blvd E, Charleston, WV 25301, USA
reviews: I have meant to do this review for sometime.  We were in town for other business.  Saw there was an escape room.  So we decided to try them out.  We did Hunters Revenge and Wicked Cavern.  I myself have done well over 200 escape rooms all over the world.  These rooms were well thought out.  The immersion was very good.  I highly recommend if your in WV.  Trying them out.  It will be well worth it.  Thank You Locked and Coded for the great time and the Owner was awesome.  I am sorry I can't for the life of me remember your name.  But you were awesome.  We will be back.  When were back in Charleston.
Stressful and fun experience for the whole family. Really appreciate the time we spent there. Super nice and helpful owners.

Rooms are extremely well done and very challenging.  The owner was super nice and gave us a sneak peak at the other rooms when we finished. Highly recommend if you are looking for something new and different to do!
It's been a while since I've been there, but they put a lot of effort into their escape rooms and I would definitely recommend them!
Great place for a group event! Our group of teenage boys had a blast getting out of jail!

name: Sky Zone Trampoline Park
reviews: Overall great for kids! Saturdays can be jam packed. I recommend purchasing in advance online and make sure the waiver is current. They have a dedicated line just for that and you get through much quicker.

I've already reviewed this indoor park. A clean, friendly environment for kids to exercise and meet new friends. What's not to love? The price. $16 an hour. A little more expensive than the movies but the exercising is priceless. There's space for toddlers too, so children of all ages (and adults too) can enjoy the art of jump. :)

We brought a group of 55 middle school students from 1.5 hours away and Sky Zone was really phenomenal to work with!  Leading up to the actual trip I gave a best guess on our amount of jumpers so I was trying to update Sky Zone as best I could and they just really rolled with it and helped us so that everyone was able to jump.  The check-in process took a minute but only because there were so many of us, they really were patient and helpful with us.

Plus the variety of options to jump was really great.  They had a rock wall, two obstacle courses, and a toddler area.  In addition to various other jumping options.  Overall I was really impressed and appreciative of Sky Zone taking time to work with us and get us all ready to go!

Took my son and some friends here for the first time and loved it! There were several different areas to explore and was well staffed to accommodate the crowd. The clerk at the front desk was very informative!   Fun for all ages!!! Will definitely be making another trip down.
Good food, lots of exercise.  Staff Is very attentive.  I wish they had some security.

name: West Virginia Governor's Mansion
address: 1716 Kanawha Blvd E, Charleston, WV 25305, USA
reviews: Located next to the capitol building. Easy access for visitors at posted visiting hours.
A SPLC-designated hate group was allowed to set up in the capitol building during West Virginia Republican Party Day. They put up hate posters. No one stopped them.
Beautiful place
Refresh the mind after visiting this place.

In the historical district around my dad's apartment complex. I used to love the beautiful scenery of the archaic homes. The purple accented one is amazing. I hope to one day have a house as beautiful and eccentric as that.

name: Coonskin Park
reviews:
Coonskin is good recreational area for our community. It could be managed better.
For example, great trail for biking and walking to downtown Charleston, but the excavation equipment has prohibited our access.
I have to carry my bike over mud and water to access the trail. Just a 3’ path of boards would open the trail. Sorry I am biking elsewhere.

Beautiful scenery, clean and cozy atmosphere. Love going to just drive around and breathe in the surrounding s. They have a decent golf course, paddle boats that you can rent . The oak room is available for the public for rental fees, for special occasions.  Great people.
Love to walk and picnic here.  Always went as a kid to ride bikes.  Fairly quiet and clean.

A wonderful place to hike around. If you are looking for the exact location of the grotto/waterfall put these coordinates into google maps: 38°23'05.4"N 81°34'29.9"W.  It's just off the Mary Knight or Oak trail.  You can enter off Henry C. Shores Dr. and enter the road that states "Areas 6-20" (38.383639, -81.580449). You will see benches on the left and can park there (38°23'06.8"N 81°34'40.5"W). Walk on the dirt road which curves around the right but don't follow it all the way to the building. Once the you see the building at the same level as you, head towards the first set of coordinates towards the grotto and you'll see some stairs which give access. :-)

Coonskin has changed a lot since I was going there since early 70's. Still a great place. Saw 2 family soldiers off to deployments to middle east. Both are WV Army National Guard. One is seasoned veteran and one is first time deployed. A great place to celebrate their deployment of service with BBQ and family fellowship.

name: Charleston Convention & Visitors Bureau
reviews: It was very enjoyable. Food was excellent and presentation was very eye appealing. Job well done.
Ate at the restaurant SOHO. Excellent food.
Very friendly people working there and not too bad on the prices
A wealth of information.

Product: Charleston, West Virginia is a beautiful city that has a lot of the big city amenities without the big city issues. The CVB is a great organization to help showcase and assist.
People: Knowledgeable,  experienced and helpful.
Place: Charleston, WV is a great place to consider for your event (s)
New state of the art Civic Center to be completed in 2018.

name: Clay Center’s Avampato Discovery Museum
reviews: My son had a blast. Will definitely go again.

name: Little Creek Park
address: 1 Little Creek Park Rd, South Charleston, WV 25309, USA
reviews:
A park that offers so much for every age group that
have beautiful trails for your family and your dog.
Picnic shelters for parties or family reunions (i think you have to reserve) 
Soccer and baseball fields are always groomed perfectly.
Then there is a track for kids to race the go carts supervised and it been there for over 50 years
The bathrooms at little creek park are always clean and sanitized which is so important. 
Ive probably missed something because they have so much to offer at the scenic family oriented park.
Huge park with something for everyone.  Nicely maintained.  Trails had some beautiful places along them.  Can't wait to explore more next weekend
It was cold (30F), but I enjoyed my nature therapy (hike).

It's a real nice place! They got different shelters that can be rented out and they have bathrooms for each one! There's some pretty cool trails to walk and there's also baseball diamonds. Park seems to be pretty well taken care of. Drove from Ohio to here for a baby shower and it was perfect for what they wanted to do and it accommodated a good amount of people.
Something for everyone! Trails, parks, soccer and baseball, creeks for the dogs... You can't go wrong

name: Shoney's Big Boy Museum
address: 1600 Kanawha Blvd W, Charleston, WV 25387, USA
reviews: Was pretty cool.  Some items looked like they'd been stolen.. but wow 1900 locations!
It's a weird pillar with no real access to it. Has some information about Shoney's Big Boy, a coffee carafe and a yo-yo. Worth looking at if you're in the area not worth making a special stop for.
Roadside Attraction if you are really curious about the Big Boy & Shoney's Restrautant Chain.
Barely worth stopping. Two display cases are empty or nearly empty.  There's a "building," a plaque, and one display case with stuff in it.

This used to be a monument to Shoney's / Big Boy. then someone whose last name rhymes with Ways got involved and the thing went sideways .. upkeep stopped, Big Boy filed a lawsuit in 2010 for trademark infringement, now it's 10 years later and it sits their neglected, very sad.

name: Daniel Boone Park
address: 2901 Kanawha Blvd E, Charleston, WV 25311, USA
reviews: Nice clean roadside stop. Saw a boat dock. Also their is a small elevated pier to fish or watch the river roll by.
I've been going here for years! On the weekends my kids love to take bread and feed the ducks. It could use some updates but still a nice to go to!
Not a park. Public Boat launch
Decent place to watch the ducks and I have never had issues putting a boat in there. They try to keep it clean and the law makes a round through now and again. Over all good place.

One of the best places in Charleston to put your boat on the river!!  The dock is perfect, we walk our pontoon right onto the trailer when we are done.  Wish they would unlock the restrooms there more often though.

name: Sunrise Carriage Trail
reviews: Absolutely gorgeous trail, with historical ties even, all in the heart of downtown Charleston 💗 very well upkeep and moderate incline but plenty of places to pause and take break along the way. Ill definitely return!

Beautiful little trail hidden across the river from downtown Charleston. The bottom lot entrance is right next to Bridge Rd at the light and can be hard to miss. Well-kept gravel trail is just over a mile round trip and has lots of tree coverage, so it's perfect even on hot, sunny days (can make it a bit dark and creepy when its later in the day though). The hillsides are covered with daffodils in the springtime, and the trail is lined with honeysuckle!
Beautiful place to walk, easy hike. It has a gravel pathway. Overlooks Charleston. Goes all the way up to the old Sunrise Museum (which is now owned by Danny Cline)
Beautiful shaded stroll with lots of interesting natural and historical features.  Great for a quick stroller jaunt...took about 30 minutes down and up at a leisurely pace.

A winding footpath that connects South Hills to the Dickinson Street Bridge, the Sunrise Carriage trail offers a great view of Charleston's downtown at the top and a peaceful, gently sloped hike with benches and stepped cut-throughs. Parking is available both at the top and at the bottom of the trail.

name: Cato Park
reviews: It's a great little park in the city, archery range, soccer fields, pool, golf course. They've made several improvements the last couple of years! The trails are nice to hike with your puppers too!
Greens are rough but it's 9 dollars for 9 holes and if you want to play 18 it's 13 dollars fairways are in great shape. Great place to play bad golf
Just passed by the golf course. It is well maintained
Always have had a great time there. Life guards have always helped with what ever I needed.
I always go here with my best friend and it’s always great, even when a lot of people are there, you still have so much room to swim

name: Joplin Park
address: Kanawha Turnpike, South Charleston, WV 25303, USA
reviews: I've went to this park since I was a small child. My kids love to take their scooters or bikes here. There's a nice paved walkway around the perimeter for you to walk on with exercise equipment every so many feet. There's a really nice dog park so your furry friends can socialize as well. Our dogs love it! They also have plastic bags to clean up after your dogs so it can be disposed of. There's a nice parking lot, swings, picnic tables, trash cans all around the park, tennis and basketball courts, playground, teeter totters, a huge field and restrooms. Our family loves having picnics and getting into a friendly family game of ball here! I recommend this park to anyone.

The most beautiful Park most relaxing place you ever want to be you can go there anytime any day I highly recommend you take your kids and dogs they have a place for the dogs who played in it's a very good part I'll give it a number one

Fantastic park! Dog area that does not require membership (great if passing through). The path around the park is smoothly paved, and never leaves sight of the play area. It has excersise checkpoints along it. Also, 2 tennis courts and basketball. A great place for the whole family.

This park offers convenient parking.  The facilities include 2 tennis courts, 2 basketball courts, swing sets, a dog park, three covered shelters with picnic tables and several shaded areas to enjoy a summer day.  The park is well maintained and clean, although the bathrooms are what you can expect.  All in all this is a wonderful park to bring your family and children of different age groups will have things to do.
Small playset and swingset with standard swings and a toddler swing. Dog park, tennis courts, basketball courts. Walking trail. Picnic shelters. Large flat area for frisbee or playing catch, etc.

name: WV Division of Culture and History
address: Capitol Complex, Building 9, 1900 Kanawha Blvd E, Charleston, WV 25305, USA
reviews: My 7 year old daughter had a blast. It is usually very difficult to gain her attention. If you do get her attention, it's near impossible to keep it for long. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted by Nathan. He was very friendly and made sure that we knew about everything they had to offer. He saw my daughter and told us all about the children's center, a place where she could do crafts and learn about West Virginia history hands on. We were here for nearly 2 hours and honestly could've stayed longer. She had so much fun and loved the exhibits. She wanted to spend all day in the children's center and asked to go back in several times. The entire experience was free and very educational.
Beautiful area to walk around and see history
Loved it!  Great attention to detail and something for everyone.  Highly recommend.
Green eggs and ham yeet
Does a great job telling the story of WV. Great visual scenes, exhibits, and sound effects.

name: Danner Meadow Park
reviews: Great park! Tons of things to do, lots of room to run, track for walking or riding bikes, hoverboards, etc. Huge, open field. Swings, nice big climbing structure. Shelter. Park is well- maintained.

Really nice park for kids and adults.. the playground has a lot of options for the kids and there's a large field for anyone to run and play and a walking and or running path goes around the entire field.

A nice play area. Tons of slides and climbing obstacles. A little dated and a bit muddy after some rain, but good. A great flat, grassy field and gravel track.  Exercise obstacles on the track, too. Parking above and at park level. Not far from the highway.

Great place for parents and kids. Running track with some exercise equipment for big people, playground for little people. Interesting setting- tucked away on top of a hill in a little sunken field, view of the open sky. Three little stone tables sit under a shelter by the playground. Run around the track or sit in the shade and watch the kids play. Unique park.

This playground is a great place for kids! We found this on a trip from Ohio to north Carolina add a place to stretch... I'd give it 5 stars of there were flushing toilets. The port-a-potties were clean, though. The park seems well maintained.

name: Wine Cellars Park
reviews:
My first visit to West Virginia and one of the places I sought out was this one. A calm, beautiful portrayal of nature with creeks winding throughout the park. The sound of the running water alone is hypnotic.

Are you a disc golf fan? You can play here inside the park. Challenging hills if you decide to hike up them. An overall gorgeous place to forest bathe. Get outside and enjoy nature in this park.

Beautiful park. It really surprised us how beautiful this park was. We walked by the cellars up a trail and you walk up a hill and there is a beautiful lake. The cellars are historically magical and would tell you so many stories if they could talk. We will be back to explore more of the trails. Also, they have disc golf!

Wine Cellar Park offers beautiful scenic trails, a older playground, a fishing lake and shelter.Its family oriented where you can also walk your dog, have family picnics and hike together.
The park has wooden bridges throughout the trail, a historic fort 
which contribute to the-rustic look of the park and it’s appeal.
 I enjoy nature very much and finding about this gem of a park was a great find
I hope you come have some fun at this wonderful place.
Great place for an outdoor family event. We recently held a baby shower there in the pavilion. It was a good afternoon and evening with family and friends.
Nice lake but the landscaping needs work. I expected it to look a lot nicer especially on a holiday weekend.

name: Mortar Man
reviews: You have to search to find him but once you spot him you have found one of charleston's secrets.
Pretty cool thing to see when there's nothing to do.
Interesting little guy, as seen on Atlas Obscura.
Interesting. Great for city scavenger hunts. Fun to go locate.
If you're in charleston on vacation like i was you know there's not that much to do so if and when you find yourself downtown look for this thing. it's pretty small, but it's worth locating.

name: Water Ways
reviews: We all had fun they tub ride needs a lil updating, we all have bruises from a week ago. Our backs from it. They need to open the other slides also!!! But a great place to take family!
Great family place but watch the water tub slide , it needs updating. Everyone had bruises on back but was very fun!
Not as bad place to hang out. A little run down though and watch your step. Lots of cracks ok the concrete to stub your toes!
First time at a water park. Was a blast. They even announced to my granddaughter a congratulations on her gymnastics awards. Was great!!
There have ride tube for slide. You have kid pool & adult pool for sperated pool. There have snack. Cash & credit card.

name: Children's Dentistry: Tracy L Wilkerson, DDS
address: 1400 Kanawha Blvd E, Charleston, WV 25301, USA
reviews: Dr. Wilkerson and her whole staff are amazing! I have never been treated with such kindness and love from any other doctors office. My boys love getting to go to the dentist! Dr. Wilkerson is so gently and amazing during procedures. They are fast and efficient with there work. I recommend them to everyone! As a mom it’s nice to have a staff that loves your kids as much as you do, and this is definitely that staff! It’s a 45 minute drive for us and it’s so worth it!

My boys love going to this office! Everyone in the office is so willing to help, always have a smile on their faces, and do what it takes to get the job done. My oldest has had to have work done and I couldn’t thank Mrs Holly & Dr. Wilkerson enough for the patients they showed him and how fast they work. I wish the office seen adults! I have three children and when I walk in their always asking if I need help. It’s just a all around wonderful establishment!

This office is the bomb dot com. We drive over an hour away for my daughter to see Dr Wilkerson. We love her and the entire staff!! Always so friendly and helpful and VERY VERY patient with my girl who tends to throw a huge fit. By the end of it she’s happy and we’re headed home in a matter of no time. From start to finish of anything she’s ever had done we’ve never been there over an hour and that is a win in my book. I will continue to make the drive to come to this office!!!

We take our four children to Dr. Wilkerson’s office. They LOVE going! And that makes me love taking them. At the last appointment that my two oldest children had, I brought along my two youngest, 3yo twins. My twins were so upset that it wasn’t their appointment and they didn’t get to sit in the chair! The dental assistant that finished first let them sit in the chair and ‘cleaned their’ teeth. It made them feel like they got the experience and it will hold them over until their scheduled appointment.
All the ladies in the office go out of their way to make the dentist a fun experience! My kids complain that their appointment isn’t soon enough!

Absolutely love this office, office staff there is so friendly and helpful! Taking my kids to the dentist is never a walk in the park so going there they make it seem so easy and help anytime my kids start throwing a fit! Dr. Wilkerson is the sweetest! Office is super clean and kid friendly! And it makes it much better that they’re quick and get us in there and get the job done! 
I wouldn’t take my kids anywhere else! ❤️

name: Saint Albans City Park
address: 71 City Park Rd, St Albans, WV 25177, USA
reviews:
This is a very clean family oriented park which is beside the kanawha river. You can bring your boat,jet ski or fishing  craft and enjoy a day on the beautiful Kanawha.
Fishing can also be done on the banks mostly catch and release is what i see fisherman doing here.
There are two shelters first come first serve where you can have parties or celebrations.
The playground has been remodeled with a locked and a padded fence installed and no dogs allowed in that area.
However you can walk your dog on a leash around the park on down the sidewalk path that gives the view of the river and three campsites.
The bathrooms are always clean when I’m there 
They do a wonderful job maintaining and doing upkeep on this Park Come see for yourself if you haven’t been.

This is a quiet place, beautiful & great for a family outing. The main trail has been redone with new bridges, benches & gravel. The only thing I noticed was that the park needed a wheelchair designated trail. That may be in the future plan.
Lots of trails—more than you might realize unless you do some exploring. Saw a good variety of mushrooms on the longer (1.5-mile) trail in June.

Clean, well maintained...bathrooms could use a little attention. We spend most of our time on the baseball field.  However, there are numerous shelters, trails, and playgrounds. The swimming pool is kept very clean, and there is an outdoor stage for concerts and plays. Durinf the summer they have an outdoor movie night. During November and December they have The Festival of Lights. A beautiful display of Christmas lights that you drive thru and at the end, Santa is setting in his rocking chair. The kids can visit with him and enjoy hot chocolate. Oh, important note...the lights are closed on Christmas eve and Christmas day. They reopen December 26.
It's a great park with some awsome softball players!!

name: Cathedral Falls
reviews: Wow, what a breathtaking view! This was an unexpected stop during a cross country drive with my family. We could have stayed for half a day to soak in the beauty. It made for some good photos of my family and a nice rest. Nature always provides for the best views when you least expect it.

Probably one of the nicest, tallest waterfalls you can access by a one minute walk from your car! Most waterfalls require at least a little trek. However, Cathedral Falls is literally within view of the parking lot, which itself is right off U.S. HWY 60. So if you're within a few miles of this place, it would be REALLY dumb if you didn't stop by. I doesn't get any easier for this type of location.
Beautiful falls, neat little area surrounding them. Slipped on the rocks and got my feet wet 😮 but water wasn't freezing 😜. Glad I stopped.
Beautiful little stop. Falls are very pretty, and was a great place for a proposal. Congratulations to a couple of our great friends.
This is a breathtaking area that everyone should stop in and take in the splendor even if it's just for a few minutes. It is easy on and off from the highway.

name: Ridenour Memorial Park
reviews: I love Ridenour. Such a beautiful gem in Nitro. Great walking trails. Pretty lake and views. Lots of small wildlife. Fun bike trails. A nice dog park. Well maintained shelter and gazebo.
We loved the RC park. Dog park looks very nice too.

I used to go to Ridenire fishing when I was a kid with my dad. Lots of good memories. 
Checked out the bark park today it was muddy & lots of trash.

Beautiful place to just hang out and fish or throw your line in. I have fished here several times and never have even got a bite. Also there a setting for weddings or other formal events. Wear your boots because there is a lot of #2 from all the geese.

Beautiful area! Didn't even know this place existed and I live close by. The place was clean and well-kept. Took my board out on the water for an hour or two and didn't want to leave. Only downside were annoying kids swimming/jumping in the lake when it's clearly no swimming.

name: Hurricane City Park
reviews: They will open 2 new trails on July 2020 about 2.5 miles and 10 miles across the railway
Best splash park in the area. Shading for the parents, seats for everyone. Food stand. Picnic tables Magic island could learn a thing or two from this amazing splash park
Cute little gem. Had a fun time at this great park. The playground equipment was great and the bathroom was clean.
Great place if it's your 1st time their , I feel like you could get burnt out very quick here and no park employees are anywhere to be found
A great little park..has it all just about everything..a walki g trail by the lake..a fishing lake..water park for the kids..basketball and baseball parks..love the park...

name: Kanawha State Forest
address: 7500 Kanawha State Forest Dr, Charleston, WV 25314, USA
reviews: I love Kanawha State Forest. Really miss the pool but love the trails. This is the best space I Charleston. Yoga Power loves hiking and doing yoga here

Beautiful area to explore. Hiking is beautiful and can be a great workout. Please be aware of snakes and wear proper gear.  Great place to bring the family. The information booth had no information but you can easily look things up on your phone. Be careful if hiking because there is no service in several areas. It will depend on you carrier. I recommend you screenshot any information to be safe.

Awesome camping spot.. playgrounds, trails.. great place for a campfire and flashlights.. there are no street lights here so it gets completely dark at night.. unless there's moonlight have a powerful flashlight with you.
There is a local hiking club that organizes hikes every weekend.  I recommend attending if you get the chance.
The Kanawha State Forest is spectacular for hiking and picture taking. I've been there three times in the past year alone and I've loved it each time.

name: Hawks Nest State Park
address: 49 Hawks Nest Rd, Ansted, WV 25812, USA
reviews: We enjoyed the tram ride and getting some great pics of the fall colors. The area is not far from Fayetteville, and the New River Gorge Bridge. The road is a little crazy but not bad at all. From soap to coffee!! Great idea!!Can’t wait to go back!! There is a small set of stairs down to the overlook but there are railings. Plenty of waterfalls close by (Mill Creek and Turkey Creek), or you can take a drive West on 60 to see more.  There's a small gift shop and a bathroom on the other side of the road. The landscaping was immaculate!  Everything was just perfect.  I have never seen a state park maintained to such perfection.

This was our first time here and I can say that I am already looking forward to coming back soon.  Everyone at the lodge was so pleasant and welcoming.  What really made our trip magical....the abundance of Hawks and wildlife.  We enjoyed the tram ride   and getting some great pics of the fall colors.  Beautiful memories.

The staff was pleasant and helpful, and the room with a view was excellent!  We stopped here for a couple nights on the way back from visiting family.  I could get the best room for less than rooms at the parks in Canaan Valley (peak in winter months).  The lodge is dated, but the room amenities are nice, and considering that breakfast was included with the room, this was a good deal.  The power went out for about eight hours due to a storm, but the crews got it back on hours before the projected repair time.  The lodge was beautifully decorated, and very homey.  The area is not far from Fayetteville, and the New River Gorge Bridge.  This is definitely on my list--I can't wait to return and stay longer next time!
Great place to go with your family. Or just as a date with your wife. The lodge is nice also. Our family loves to go here.
This is a cool park with a lot to offer and see for families.  We did a short hike to check out the views and we were not disappointed.  Our 5 and 3 year olds enjoyed it

name: Canyon Rim Visitor Center
address: 162 Visitor Center Rd, Lansing, WV 25862, USA
reviews: Fantastic  view of the New River Gorge Bridge.  It is quite a breathtaking sight to see it.  The river is a jaw dropping 876 feet below the bridge deck.  It is quite beautiful.  If you’re headed to West Virgina and your schedule permits, I wouldn’t miss this one.

Well worth the trip although there's not a lot else to see in the area. The views over the river gorge and the magnificent arched bridge are terrific. There's a visitor centre explaining all about the formation of the gorge and the construction of the bridge.
Beautiful view of the gorge. Knowledgeable park rangers. The stairs down to the viewing area are easy; coming up is more tiring! Definitely worth the effort, though.
Very nice! If you don't mind walking a bunch of steps you can get some really nice views outside. Inside views and these from the deck are wonderful!

Our first stop before hitting the trails around New River Gorge, and our favourite place to have a picnic lunch! The short walkway to the bridge views  provides opportunities to see local birds and reptiles!

name: New River Gorge Bridge
reviews: Absolutely beautiful place!! If you’re in the area, it’s a definite must see. Greatly enjoyed all the ways to view the bridge from different perspectives. If you have some time, I’d highly recommend doing the bridge walk. Although I’m scared to death of heights, it was a thrilling experience!!

I love the NRG. Usually go up to kayak the river, but on occasion will hike the trails to the overlooks to look down on the river. It’s such a special place. If you haven’t seen this spectacular bridge, it’s well worth a trip to see it!

Amazing..  be sure to take the road that goes below the bridge amd across the old bridge.  It is a spectacular view from underneath the bridge as well.  From the river you can watch rafters go down the rapids.  There are several trails which all give you unique views.  Dont just drive over it.  Stop and explore.  Well worth the time.

Awesome experience with fantastic views. This is the perfect place to stop for a break. If possible, take the route back down under the bridge as well, there are a few stops along the way and it's simply awesome, especially in the fall with all of the leaves changing.
It's so pretty here . So many trails and you can go rafting . It's a great place to visit .

name: Dodson Pest Control
address: 3924 Washington St W, Charleston, WV 25312, USA
reviews: I called for a last minute termite inspection and the guy was very nice and patient over the phone. Brandon Rhodes came out, was 10 minutes early and kept me informed on what all he was doing. I would definitely recommend this company and Brandon!
I was taken care of Brandon Rhodes and he was great. He came early and was cooperative. He made sure we were thoroughly informed about what was going on and made sure we had a good experience.
Dodson’s service technicians are very professional and do a great job keeping our business pest free. Highly recommend.
Fixed an ant problem for me in one visit. On time , great price, friendly service. Recommend
They were able to effectively get rid of a roach problem that me and girlfriend had in my apartment. They came on time, handled the problem in one visit and we have yet to see a roach since.

name: Babcock State Park
reviews: Great place to see! Not hard to find! During off season go use the restroom at a nearby gas station first. Also the island in the sky trail is across from the mill. The walk is about 20 minutes one way and I'm fat and got up there just fine. There are two small mad made ladders on the trail to get up some rocks. Not too scary. Do it and have fun!

Babcock State Park met my expectations of a private forest retreat surrounded by the beauty of fall season. My friend and I stayed in an economy cabin that included a queen size bunk bed, kitchen, two dressers, bathroom, screened in porch, fire pit, picnic table, and grill. I loved building fires and standing outside under the moon, stars, and beautiful fall foliage. The cabin experience could be considered rustic but other than needing a little bathroom dusting, it was clean, organized, and expended at an excellent price. We loved walking around the park between overlooks, the grist mill, and the lake. The roads were in great condition and the park itself looked well maintained. The hospitality was remarkable. Well done staff of Babcock State Park:)

Beautiful park. Stopped by the grist mill, took some great pictures. Enjoyed the sound of the water. Very relaxing. Hiked around the lake. Trail was well maintained. One of my favorite hikes yet. Easy to moderate so nothing too strenuous yet good for the soul.
By far one of the most beautiful places I've ever seen! We took so many pictures and plan on using the for calendars. I highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone!

I really like this place, lots of trails for hiking and biking. Plus the lake is a nice feature. Their is a grist mill that you can walk through which is the parks main attraction but it has very limited hours. There is a gift shop their that's has some nice things. The down sides pretty much are the grist mill isnt open much, theirs no place to get anything more then snacks atleast 10 minutes from the park, and you cant swim in the lake.

name: Clay Center
reviews: The children’s museum is AWESOME. Me and my child visit frequently. Only thing I wish is  that they would show different shows in the theater. As for that. We love the place.

Flawless acoustics and comfortable seats enhance the great shows offered at The Clay Center for the Arts and Sciences. The hands-on children's discovery museum and the small but high quality art museum make it fun for all ages and interests. There's also a great planetarium that also shows interesting, educational short films.

Today was a free day! My kids enjoy every visit. There is always something to excite their minds and curiosity. The downstairs mini city is a great training facility - car care center, bank, grocery store, diner, etc. Fun and education makes a great time for children and adults
This concert venue has excellent acoustics. It's always a pleasure to sing here with the WV Symphony.
I love our new clay center if I could I'd work for it. I attend recitals, networks, gala, music artists and the wv symphony. It beautifully done and people show up from everywhere.

name: Mystery Hole
reviews: This place has been here 40 plus years over my years of traveling to it I have made an unspoken friendship with the owners and dont even know others names but when we see one another here we light up with smiles and a warm greeting what makes this place so special is still a MYSTERY you must stop here ESPECIALLY if you have children

A neat little tourist trap using optical illusions and physics to warp your senses. Definitely heed the warnings. On the outside, just a small shack that goes about 3 levels deep but the name alone and the outside aethetics catch your eye to bring you in to a tour guide who is quite a showman himself. An alright stop if you have time to kill or are in the surrounding camp grounds and parks.

Quick fun stop. Great views and pretty good parking. I did feel a difference  in the gravity room, but it did seem like the feeling was magnified by the built angles in the room. It felt like the demonstrator tried to creep out the crowd. They try hard to make the experience last longer than what it really should, which is appreciated... but honestly I felt dizzy and was ready for it to be over. I wouldn't say it was a waste of time because it was a fun experience with my family. We also saw 2 waterfalls along the route to mystery hole, so overall it was a fun family experience!
Note: the website says no large back packs or purses, so we took small ones and was still told they couldn't be taken in, on a positive note the shop offered free lockers to store our bags
It is the great stop on the hawk nest experience.  Simple little spot.  Friendly staff. And a funny little tour.
Good place to get some WV souvenirs. And fun for the kids to go through the tour

name: Davis Park
reviews: Park has had a few upgrades over the recent years and is really nice. If the city could do something to address the homeless in the area I'd spend more time here, as it is the panhandlers can be aggressive. This is why I carry a sailors emergency boat whistle and make, being told to for over $5 buck or else is kinda a turn off.
Great place to hang out for those warm weather concerts.
Great time outside.
Quiet pocket park with comfortable seating. Best used during daylight when  downtown workers are present or during events -- and then, of course, it is not quiet.

Thanks to shortsighted miss management by city administration, the dozens of century old trees have been cut down turning what used to a cool green haven from the city heat into a sunsoaked oven that's unpleasant to even walk thru...sad to see what used to a gem in the city turn into an empty plaza no one uses anymore

name: Heritage Farm Museum & Village
reviews: Heritage Farm offers a kid friendly, historical journey through Appalachia.  So many fun and interesting activities for the kiddos, including an entire building dedicated to arts and crafts "The Maker Space", a couple playgrounds,  a transportation museum, a doll museum, animals and so much more.  And Christmas time here is super fun!  Definitely something for the whole family to enjoy!

A wonderful place to visit. People were super friendly and knowledgeable.  Fastanating and interesting collection of antiques.  The way it's set up is well worth the trip no matter what weather the is. Just happen to get a personal tour and the guy had friends in the town I grew up in.  Neat...

This place is truly a local treasure.  A great family friendly place to take kids on the weekend, Heritage Farm has numerous museums, restored log cabins, a "Maker Space" where kids can make arts and crafts, and numerous artisans who demonstrate their crafts.  Go during one of Heriage Farms "Way Back Weekends," you wont be disappointed.
Spend the day with grandson and his 1st grade class recently.  The people that work there are really nice and knowledgeable.  The tour is well organized. Had a great day.

Wonderful museum!!  Well worth seeing.
It is difficult to describe the extent that these people have gone to create such an all encompassing historical display.  There were many items that we had never seen even in other museums.  We had an exceptional male tour guide.

name: New River Gorge National River
reviews: Easily one of the most beautiful places in the entire country! There are beautiful hiking trails and overlooks, world class whitewater rafting, rock climbing, and ziplining. The New River Gorge has something for everyone and is a bucket list destination that you should not miss! Also, definitely make sure to check out Bridge Day in October for one of the coolest festivals on earth!
I love this place! And always wanted to spend more time exploring. I’m definitely going to add to my bucket list to spend an entire month.
What an awesome view from Turkey Spur and the Main Overlook. The pics are great but hardly shows the beauty and size of this breathtaking park. I am looking forward to finding more spots to see.
Love this place. Try an go on bridge day. Get there early or you have to walk a ways. It worth the trip..

Fantastic place for whitewater rafting on class 4 and 5 rapids. Been here twice and each experience was awesome.  The experience is so much fun and the guides are the best.  They will truly make your experience so much more if you are personable and respectable. Remember to tip your guides, its the right thing to do!

name: Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine
reviews: WOW........ this is an Awesome place to bring family, friends, school group, Church group or just stop in by yourself. This is a must see and do, not to be missed or dismissed. The overall facility is very well laid out, maintained by a great dedicated group of knowledgeable people. There's even Retired Coal Miners that were there to run the buggy back in the ground to experience the mining industry. They were very friendly and knowledgeable, answering every question regardless of the relatively. We really enjoyed going in the Old Camp Buildings, Houses, and Schools. The HandsOn Caboose was a great big hit with our younger children in the group. The Gift Shop was great as well, and the fudge.... well I wish I would have bought more and more. Thanks for sharing your facility,  teaching us the history of mining and not letting it die.

I really enjoyed it all. It is a small coal mine tour and a small recreation of a coal mine village. But it gives you a complete picture of how this area of the country grew and functioned. For those of us who had relatives in the industry, we get a snap shot of what life was all about.

While this exhibition is naturally a sanitized version of the "real thing";  particularly, the height of the main line, there is quite a bit of true and accurate representations of what coal mining was like mainly circa 1950.  The park itself is a little difficult to find, so follow your GPS VERY carefully.  The parking is ample and accommodating for RV's.  The Rahall Coal Country Store is an excellent exhibit itself.
Wonderful place with very nice people. Would definitely recommend this place for the whole family. Lots of history about coal mining and a overall great experience.

Loved it! Real underground coal mine! Guide was great!, friendly,  super informative and funny! All the homes and old items in them was nice to see too. Ladies in the gift shop were so sweet. Speaking of sweet, we loved their fudge!  Easy parking right in front. Glad we went.

name: Mothman Museum
address: 400 Main St, Point Pleasant, WV 25550, USA
reviews: Me and my fiance went here for my birthday a few weeks ago and had so much fun. And the guy who worked there I think his name was Jeremy and we was very nice and chatted with is for a bit. Overall a great experience and would definitely recommend 😊

A must for any paranormal researcher!   We actually based on summer trip on stopping at this location during our travels and we were NOT disappointed.   The collection of information surrounding the Mothman phenomenon is simply amazing.   Intermission was very reasonable, and the gift show was awesome.   We have a full review of this location on our website and YouTube channel.

So cool to finally get to explore the Mothman Museum today. Very interesting to see the handwritten statements from witnesses, the John Keel collection and all the movie props, too. Fun stop, and definitely grab a Mothman Root beer while you are there. Super tasty!

Very cheap admission and interesting displays, but don't expect to spend a large amount of time here-- the standard Mothman enthusiast will probably spend at most an hour browsing through the two main rooms and watching the short film. The gift shop was fantastic, with a large amount of Mothman knickknacks and souvenirs to show off to family and friends back home. The statue outside the museum is also a great photo opportunity.

Not only did I have a blast, but the facility was clean and the staff very friendly. They also had a great amount of fun nicknacks and cryptic paraphernalia. If you are anywhere near Point Pleasant, do yourself a favor and check this place out.

name: Carnifex Ferry Battlefield State Park
address: 1194 Carnifex Ferry Crossing, Summersville, WV 26651, USA
reviews: This is an out-of-the-way gem, beautifully maintained by the WV State Park system. This is the site of one of the earliest Civil War land battles. The original farmhouse that was caught in the crossfire still stands. For more historical context, you may be interested in the historical fiction novel Panther Mountain: Lydia's Story, available on Google Books.

Well maintained and clean.  Shelters are in well located areas.  There is a playground for the children.  The scenic overlooks are beautiful.  Plenty of trails to follow.  There are multiple history markers throughout the grounds and an 1800's home you can tour.  Don't forget to walk across the field to look at the cannon.  Takes you back in time if you can just visualize the journey.

Great little Civil War battlefield state park. Living nearby I have come here many times from childhood 'til now. Very picturesque and tranquil this day-use park offers hiking trails, picnic tables, playground, three pavilions for get togethers, an overlook of the beautiful Gauley River, a Civil War museum, and other features. This park is well kept and family friendly.
Loved this place. Family friendly, beautiful well kept grounds, informative signs marking historical areas.
Very beautiful especially the over look

name: Koenig Art Emporium
reviews: Excellent and helpful staff, great work. Nice gallery with an exhibit of local artists each month or so. Reasonable prices, this is a custom frame shop so don't go expecting your frame work to be done next day!
Great owner and fantastic art work.
This is worth a look if you got the time
THE ART EMPORIUM had such a great selection of art.  I would recommend everyone to stop by for all the Christmas  deals.  Many items to choose from.
Amazing shop run by amazing people

name: Mountain State Miniature Golf
reviews: As this is the only climbing gym I've ever been to, I honestly can't say how it attacks up, BUT I can say the staff is awesome. They were great with our kids as we had our daughters 9th b day party there. They went out of their way to make sure they all had a great time. Knowledgeable, professional and nice. Couldn't have asked for it to go better.

One of the best mini golf courses I've ever played. Very challenging. The course is in a comfortable wooded area and each hole includes factual information about West Virginia history. They also have a rock climbing wall inside.
A legit history lesson of West Virginia,  while having fun put-put golfing. They even had Mothman! Worth the stop to stretch legs while traveling!
Great place!!! So glad we tried the miniature golf and coffee/drink products. Great, helpful staff, too.

This was one of the coolest mini golf courses that my husband and I have ever played! Each hole had fun facts about specific WV-related people, places and things. They were all also rather difficult holes, not the usual par 2 or 3 for everything. Loved this course!

name: Pies & Pints - Charleston, WV
reviews: Pork and pepper nachos are a amazing way to break your vegan or plant based diet. Love the tasty thin crust pies. Half artichoke  special and chicken gouda with bacon. A great selections of brews. Had to drive so only one but 2 more to go. I do recommend

Black bean pie - a taste sensation!!!!
Always delicious but the one I picked up 4/18 was AMAZING! Great food and super friendly service much appreciated:)

Pies & Pints is a West Virginia institution. Over the last several years, I've had every single menu item at one point or another. And they were all excellent. You know how some restaurants will have some good some great and some not so good? Well Pies & Pints is always great. Salads: Amazing, Pizzas: Incredible! One of my friends who moved away from the area just texted me. "Pies & Pints, oh how I miss thee."

Pizza Yes. Beer Yes. Go and you will be pleased.

This place has a as unique approach to pizza. They use gourmet ingredients in cool combinations. I’m sure you can get the standard, routing pizzas like pepperoni, sausage, etc. but why?! These cool flavors are great! I had their version of a Hawaiian pizza. It has feta cheese, bacon, pineapple, and ham. I got the sauce on the side and did some dipping.

They have a great selection of beer as well. I had Bitbutger on tap yum.

For your information, those nachos are almost enough to feed a small army.

The wait was expedient.
The people were helpful and knowledgeable.
The atmosphere is loud and social.
There are multiple seating options.
Parking is typical for a downtown area.

I’ll be back.

Really cool spot in Charleston, street parking was close and free on the weekend. We were able to grab a seat for two relatively fast, it was super crowded but we were not in a hurry. We ordered wings and pizza, the wings weren't anything to write home about but the dip was fantastic, and the pizza was some of the best I've had. Great selection of craft beers, draft and bottle, as well as a wide variety of OH & WV based breweries.

name: Visionworks Charleston Town Center Mall
address: 1031 Charleston Town Center Mall, Charleston, WV 25389, USA
reviews: Ordered 2 pairs just over a week ago using their buy one get one special. They had the best frame selection out of any place I’ve been in Charleston! The manager, Melissa, helped me. She was extremely nice and didn’t try to push me to buy this or that. She told me 14 days for my glasses, but I received them in just over a week! (Although I wouldn’t necessarily expect that kind of speed every single time, as how quickly they’re made obviously depends on your prescription, the delivery service, etc). The lady who dispensed them - I think her name was Tara, was also very nice and helpful. She adjusted my glasses perfectly. I’ll definitely be coming back here for future purchases. Better service, cleaner store, better deals, and better frame selection than ANY place in Charleston. These are my favorite glasses I’ve ever gotten!! If you come here, definitely ask for Melissa or Tara if available. 11/10 recommend this place.
Glasses good.

My daughter got her first pair of glasses yesterday. Donald was extremely helpful, professional and patient. She tried on at least 20 pairs and he was never aggravated with her. He was very knowledgeable on the glasses and proper fit. As well as insurance. I will definitely use Visionworks again and recommend to anyone. Thank you!

Couldnt find the right pair for 2 weeks, each place I would stop at just made me feel as if I was an inconvenience for them. When I came by this location, it was honestly my last try and the service and professionalism given to me by Tara was just out of this world. I've already told many friends and my social media about how great Tara was and to always go to this location. Thank you for given me my sight again Terra!!!

Was able to walk in. We had our eyes checked within 20-30 minutes, had our glasses picked about 40-60 minutes after arriving. I highly recommend. I had quite a few picks I liked couldn't make my mind up, and Tara helped me a lot and kept it real. She's the real mvp. She was extremely nice, and because of everyone being so friendly I will be back. I will be telling people about this.

name: Blennerhassett Island Historical State Park
reviews: To start off, this island is beautiful! It's well kept and there are some beautiful, massive Sycamore Trees out here. The ferry ride to get here is fun, and I think $10 is pretty darn reasonable. The history here is awesome! There are many signs and a few volunteers that'll tell you some of the history. And finally, there are some very nice trails too. Overall, an excellent start to my first time being in West Virginia!

This place is AWESOME. My favorite part of a road trip to WV was going here. Oy reachable via ferry ride. The ferry ride was affordable and a LOT of fun with my little girl. It's about a 20 minute boat ride down the beautiful Ohio River. 

The island itself is pristine. A cool gift shop, historical and preserved buildings, a lot of history and good signage. The trails and roads are very well kept and I was pushing my baby girl in a stroller. The island is quite big, heavily shaded, and flat. Beautiful outdoors area!

What a wonderful hidden treasure. Beautiful house and wonderful look at history. Exceptional fun experience for the whole family. The staff was outstanding, the food was great, wagon ride was very informative and the boat ride to and from the island was outstanding. Fun for whole family.
Greeters are informative and engaging regarding the history of the Island during that period of time.  Gift shop and eats on site.  Set aside at least 3 hours and go there!
So much fun was had! We will definitely be going back to revisit. Everyone was so. Ice and there was so much to do.

name: Taylor Books
reviews:
This is not only a unique book store its also a well known coffee place that Charlestonians hang out.
I would say this is the most popular place for people to visit with friends and have a cuppa.
The decor is unique,inviting and a great atmosphere for all individuals.
There are many items other than books and coffee at Taylors.
Such as baked goods, lunch items,greeting cards and fantastic finger puppets.
If your in the Charleston area don’t miss out on this Book and Coffee Haven.

I love Bagel, Cream Cheese, Lox for an early breakfast. With a Lemon Square and a CRAZY WHITE GIRL, Or Emerald Isle. Their White Hot Cocoas are delicious.  Also Milky Way Blast(cold with whipped cream)for a summer afternoon pick me up. And Wildberry Smoothies

Cute bookshop with new, used, and super cheap sections.  They have a coffee shop that I haven't tried but smells amazing. But the really neat thing is the art show that changes out often on one side of the store. Friendly staff.
It's a chill small business spot where you can grab some Java,  buy a book, relax in a comfortable chair reading it.  Free wifi and lots of great art and quirky knick knacks

One of my favorite ways to spend a couple hours in Charleston, WV. New and used books, great coffee, local artwork, and oftentimes, live music! Great place to hang out with a friend or have some time to myself.

name: Winterplace Ski Resort
address: 100 Old, Flat Top Mountain Road, Ghent, WV 25843, USA
reviews: Not a bad mountain at all. Good for beginner to intermediate riders. Weather conditions were awesome. Staff was friendly and helpful. They offer a great exchange program. If your board/skis break or you want to try a different size/style of board or ski, you can use your own board/ski as collateral, and they will let you use a rental at no cost. My bindings broke and I got to try out a few different size boards. Pretty cool if your looking to try something different. Again, not a great expert mountain, but really good for beginners and intermediate riders.

This place is awesome. Very friendly staff and very helpful. Had a great time, book an all in one package with the lesson, it was great. Conditions were perfect everything went well. Couldn't be happier with my experience. Make sure you come early and prepare to spend about an hour inside filling out paper work and getting fitted for gear before you hit the slopes.  All in all it was Awesome!

The lessons were not as good as I thought they would be. The slopes needed a bit more snow on them. And it was very difficult to find out which slopes were open or not. On the other hand, it was SKIING so lots of fun there! It was a great experience to go hang out with friends and family, and they had very nice people working which was surprising considering how many people they have to deal with everyday. So I would check it out. I loved it. It was a great weekend.

Visited Winterplace New year's day. Fortunately they had a little bit of natural snow overnight but they did have to produce snow as well. They had a little over half of their runs open. Had a very enjoyable day of skiing. The resort was run efficiently. Staff was excellent. The cafe food was not that great but did the job. If you are looking for an affordable day of skiing you should checkout Winterplace ski resort.

Snow not being made daily so check the cams/weather before you go . If your staying at mountain inn be aware it's all stairs and no elevators so you'll be lugging stuff up with no bell man or bell carts. The bedrooms are also above , loft style so pack light or get ready to carry a lot. Having said that great resort . We had Dwight as a private instructor 3 days in a row and was great with our 4 yr old.

Overall very friendly staff , easy parking, and easy to get around, book lessons, rent gear etc.

name: Creative Pediatric Dentistry
address: 3520 Teays Valley Road #1, Hurricane, WV 25526, USA
reviews: Absolutely amazing office staff! My daughter has high anxiety about the dentist and the girls there immediately put her at ease, they were so good with her! Dr. Lizzie was so sweet and gentle, she's a great dentist! Highly recommend this dentist office for your little ones!
We love this dental office! Honestly, can’t say one bad thing. They’re kind, patient and knowledgeable. They make our girls feel good about coming to the dentist! Dr. Lizzie is the BEST!

Dr Lizzie and her entire staff are angels! My children always have a positive experience at their office, and look forward to going every 6 months. I truly cannot speak highly enough of Dr Lizzie and her girls!
They are the absolute best. We’ve been five times now, and I’m impressed with how patient, kind and understanding they are to my three year old every time.

Dr.Lizzie and all of her staff are fantastic! I took my son, 1 year old, and they were so amazing and patient. Every person that you encounter has a smile on their face! It was both a great environment and experience!

name: Yoga Power, LLC
reviews: Supportive, fun, diverse yoga classes, and open workshops taught by wonderful, experienced, professional instructors! Make this studio your home base for all your fitness needs.  Everyone cares about you and your wellbeing  from the staff that checks you in and greets you as you enter the door to the final namaste in each class.  Since this studio opened I’ve taken over 400 classes.  Trust me, I know!  Love you all.

I love Yoga Power! From the people at the front desk to the teachers to the owner, everyone is kind, welcoming, and - most importantly - knowledgeable. If you want a funky class (Hip Hop Yoga) or a traditional class (Yin), there is a class for you. I've been doing yoga 20 years, and I take my yoga practice seriously. I highly recommend this studio.

I love the clean, warm atmosphere.  The instructors are so wonderful; they have no problem coming around to aid you for repositioning and maintaining proper alignment, which is nice for beginners like me!

Just getting back into Yoga and what a pleasant surprise Yoga Power has been.  Used the free week to take from multiple instructors.  Found each to be very good.   Studio is very pretty and a comfort to be in.   Will soon be getting a membership and its incredibly affordable.   Great instructors, great facility, great prices... great Yoga.   Namaste.

I came to try acrobat yoga for the first time. Nate and Angie led a great class and had a group of beginners flying in no time. 

There is a lot to like about this yoga studio: it’s clean and well decorated; the staff is very friendly; there are many class offerings to fit busy schedules; and there’s even a bar. 

Go and check it out!

name: Wild blue adventure company
reviews: I highly recommend visiting if you're in the area.  The hangar and plane are immaculate with a great deal of attention paid to the details of making it look like it came straight out of WW2.  The ride itself was fantastic, the pilot is just a really nice person and talked through everything so there were no surprises and I was able to feel confident trying some aerobatics.  I'm glad I did!  The flight itself is over a gorgeous area and Chris knows a lot about the area, from historical sites to good hiking trails.  This was truly a unique experience and I cannot recommend it enough!
Went to a baby shower here. Very beautiful place
Amazing views from this Stearman Biplane. The Pilot was so nice and very professional. I would recommend taking a flight to see the New River Bridge and Gorge.
Take your breath away! Pump up your adrenaline! Like a zip line times NINE!!
Wouldn't let my boyfriend ride because of his weight I'm chubby and his son was very disappointed ☹️

name: Buffalo Mountain Trailhead, Hatfield-McCoy Trails
address: 34 Oakwood Heights Road, Williamson, WV 25661, USA
reviews:
Don't give these out much, but this place is amazing. To many trails to talk about, but hit the 199 single track trail and you won't regret it. 
#LetsGuide

The trail system is large and super fun. There are plenty of places to eat, get gas, and even get your rig fixed if you were dumb and bought a Polaris. Very friendly people all throughout the area.  Had a great time!
Trail Heaven explains it! They keep trails in great shape and are always taking care of them!

Second time to HFM and this trip was BM. Great trails.. intermediate at most.. little more narrow than Indian and pinnacle, 2 wide SxS head on could be a challenge in spots.

We stayed at Wildwood Cabins in Gilbert... Highly recommend them to stay at. Direct access to Rock House, 35 minute trailer drive to BM.
It's a awesome trail for your quad or side by side👌

name: Lost World Caverns
address: 907 Lost World Rd, Lewisburg, WV 24901, USA
reviews: This is a great stop in the middle of nowhere. I was tired of driving and this place was like a drink of fresh water. It has a cute little gift shop. The tavern is self guided so no wait! You can go in and read about all of the formations. Highly recommend as a great pit stop.

We enjoyed our visit to the caverns. There's plenty to see without it being overwhelming, and there are lots of signs explaining the different formations. We found a Groupon that made our visit really affordable.
Great experience, especially for the price! Highly recommend and would visit again. The workers in the shop were extremely friendly and knowledgeable.
My family and had a great time. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The gift shop was awesome. I would love to do the climbing tour.
Great group of guides.  Very patient and knowledgable with our large church group.  We come every other year, and it is a great experience for the kids.

name: Mountwood Park
reviews: Awesome hiking experience!! It's really beautiful and it's full of wildlife. Make sure you're in good shape if you come here because it is quite hilly, but every step is worth it. You could hike forever out here!

Have been to the lake many times. Lovely place, lots of fun places to walk .
Nice hiking trails. So much wildlife and places with great veiws. Just amazing this time of year.
Great trails! Lovely park on the outskirts of Parkersburg. Looking forward to returning in warmer weather to go kayaking and hiking. If we had horses we'd ride the trails and go to the horse camp.

Been coming to this park sense it began.It is a very nice place for people to come and enjoy the great out doors.There is something  for every one. This time of year trout fishing is the big thing. Hundreds of people line the banks and float the lake for trout. This week it's been a little muddy and cold but a whole lot of people turned out for trout fishing. Even though the weather is cold there is a lot of smiles and some pretty nice catches.
Great park with lots to do and always clean.

name: Camden Park
reviews: This park is over 100 years old, so expectations about quality and aesthetic can't be high going in. It's a fun place to visit with family, especially with kids.  Definitely worth a visit if you have little ones. So many fun rides here!

It's not that I dislike Camden Park but we bought seasonal passes and also parking passes which weren't too bad price wise but I have a 13 and 14 year old and basically once you've gone a couple of times you're kind of set they got bored with it very easily. Years ago it was a fantastic place to go but it's quite dirty now and kind of I really don't know the correct word just didn't feel it he's there.

I loved it when I took my son this year!! I would recommend it to anyone that has kids, ANY AGE!! I love that they have plenty of rides for younger children because, in the past, I have taken my little boy to fairs and carnivals where he wasn't able to ride any of the rides (because he wasn't tall enough)! I would pay for a wristband so he could ride, the kid rides, all day! So, I will definitely be visiting this place in the future!
 The reason it didn't get a five star rating is because a few of the rides could use a little TLC!! They honestly didn't look safe for me to ride...so I would definitely not allow my child to ride! 
 Overall though...a great place!!! 💖 👨‍👩‍👦 💖
My son's school went to Camden Park for a Field Trip. It was a great time! We had a blast 😊
Was a great get away with the hubbie.. and we had a blast on all the rides.  Love the No waiting to ride but ensure was HOT..

name: Bluestone State Park
reviews: If you want to get away from it all (but not too far), this is the the place. Cabins are comfortable, have WiFi and AC (reducing the danger to be killed by wife and kids). Towels and linens provided. Kitchen equipment a bit spare, but manageable. Park staff very friendly.

Its absolutely beautiful.. These are just a few of the beautiful pictures of this awesome place..
Mary Plumley

Small great park, lots of fun trails. It is a smaller WV state park but it is maintained well. The  cabins are very nice: comfortable beds, couches and full kitchen. No complaints at all and would love to go back.
Quiet park. Nice big spots.  Roads are NOT big rig friendly though.
Just stopped here to see 3 waterfalls, all can be seen from the boat launch. But this lake is beautiful, nonetheless.

name: Monongahela National Forest
reviews: The whole area is beautiful and varied especially in terrain and loop distance. Some trails however do not loop but most of them connect to another trail that you can use to loop back. Have a detailed map and good sturdy shoes. Know and remember where the water sources are. get there really early like at the crack of dawn in order to find parking. This can be a very busy place. Also I don't suggest you drive in at night. It's dangerous going up that mountain with all the deer hanging out by the side of the road. Hard to see them in that pitch black darkness. Beautiful drive out though! Will most definitely return.

So I had to take my Heavy haul truck up through the mountains to get to this location to pick up a piece of equipment and turn around and come right back down the mountain...I wasn't there as a tourist but I'll tell you it's beautiful scenery... and it's pretty challenging on a truck empty let alone loaded... I brought a hundred thirty thousand pounds back down...
It was challenging took a long time to go very short distance.. 60 miles in 2 hours...
Yes that's 30 miles per hour...
Long-haul truckers would be broke if every hour went like that..
so trying to tell you this is some beautiful West Virginia countryside and I'd recommend to pass through here.. 
And by the way the folks I met up there are very helpful and friendly.
I recommend this area for all folks both commercially and for income.. and to see a very beautiful land.
I spent some time on Spruce Knob mountain over Labor Day weekend. The scenery is absolutely breathtaking. I was attending an astronomy event, and can not wait to go back.
Gorgeous and wild, a gem of nature in West Virginia. Definitely worth a visit to explore all the natural beauty this magical place has to offer in every season of the year.

This is a huge area and is my favorite playground hunting fishing hiking they have it all.  Cass scenic railroad Williams river trout fishing camping in Rock house.  I love this place.  You have to check it out.  Green bank is also nearby for those interested in a radio.observatory

name: Henderson Hall
reviews: We stopped by the home while it was closed for the winter. The home is beautiful with early American architecture. The grounds of the property has rich history as well.
It's amazing that everything in the house is original to the house - the family saved everything!
I was allowed to have my son's christening on the site while we had our civil war event
Beautiful and interesting. Highly recommend a visit.

A wonderful day! This was our second cruise and it was just perfect. The food fantastic, the history and local knowledge given during our river cruise, was so interesting. Even though I grew up in Zanesville, I have learned things I didn't know.  
I can't wait for our next excursion!!!

name: Oil & Gas Museum
reviews: Very old building that could use repair and cleaning. But it was filled with all kinds of historical treasures. If you like history of any kind definitely take the time and check it out.
Great museum. My child and I had so much fun . It is a huge museum with items to explore from top to bottom.
Wonderful walk back into the area's history! Not only a history of oil drilling in the region, but many exhibits on the civil war, WW1, and lovely antiques! Admission is $7 for adults.
I’m so excited to find this gem. Literally sitting on the door steps on this fine dreary October Saturday waiting for it to open like a school girl.
The local history is so fascinating. Just to cool.

name: Laury's Restaurant
address: 350 MacCorkle Ave SE, Charleston, WV 25314, USA
reviews: Husband took me there last year for our anniversary.  It was amazing!  Cannot wait until they are open back to regular hours and dining in.  Awesome drinks.

Order your souffles first folks, they do take half an hour.

Asparagus and steak was great. Scallops slightly undercooked.

Took my son for his 19th birthday. He enjoyed everything. He starved himself all day in anticipation for the great food I told him about. Laura (our server) I hope I am remembering her name correctly was fantastic. She was attentive without being disruptive always giving us everything we needed to enjoy our meals and each other's company. The only thing I was disappointed in was my dessert 😢 I have to mention it because she had to get someone else to make it. I ordered Bananas Foster. It was so bland. It was just like eating vanilla ice cream with a few bananas on top. There has to be more to it than that. Or there wouldn't have been so many great reviews about it on here. I hope this review just gives room for improvement. Next time I'll just skip it though.  Steaks were PERFECTION!!!
Fine dining. One of me and my Husbands favorite local restaurants. Love the owner. He always makes sure we are well taken care of.
It was a really nice place, amazing food!  Our server was so friendly and did a great job!

name: Noah's Restaurant & Lounge
reviews: Always a tasteful and well executed meal. On our last visit we had the Valentine Tasting Menu, and it was exquisite. I love that the menu is rotated here and changed based on availability and freshness of ingredients. Will definitely be making reservations again in the near future.
A great time, good food, awesome service
I ate at the bar since I was by myself, friendly service and amazing food.  Very impressed with the flavor and presentation.

Quality.Tasty. Indulgent. If you're looking for  a ton of food regardless of taste, then this is not the place. But if you're looking for decadence in every morsel; attention to detail in service, presentation, and flavor, then Noah's is the place. Loved it!
The food was delicious. Excellent waiting staff, I highly recommend this restaurant

name: Bluegrass Kitchen
address: 1600 Washington St E, Charleston, WV 25311, USA
reviews: Wow. I loved my Vegetarian Burger. The place was soo interesting and informative. Postings for all the concerts in the area. Beautiful decor that fit the theme. I had a gin and tonic that was great and they have a wonderful selection of drinks to choose from. I definitely am putting this one on the must do when in Charleston list . I loved that the whole staff was friendly and helpful but not intrusive.

Very hip joint! Live music. Cool art for sale on the walls and an awesome selection of cocktails! Our server had us laughing and enjoying ourselves while doing her job very well. The food all came out beautifully. A unique menu that changes frequently. Looking forward to another visit

I like this restaurant. The service is always good and the food never disappoints. I had  dinner here with my partner on a recent Friday eve. Jeff had the pork chops with sweet mashed potatoes and asparagus and liked it very much.
