I had the fish and chips which were served hot and delicious and a very good spinach salad with fresh vegetables, warm bacon and strawberry vinaigrette- yum!
Food and service is always top notch. Definitely one of our favorite restaurants. Love the atmosphere. Wine and beer selection is also very good. Highly recommend.
Beautiful vibe and delicious big portion plates! Bar tender gets 5 stars for the amazing cocktails.

name: Black Sheep
reviews: The owner personally went up to every table to and checked to make sure everything was great. The drinks were amazing. The waiter was busy but still personable. I had a great meal in a great atmosphere. This was my first time to Charleston, WV and it was great

Decent food. Good atmosphere but seems a little.....reserved. In that, I mean, staff seems more intent on talking among themselves & patrons seemed to keep to themselves.
Beer was good. But weirdly, their website has NO beers advertised, nothing.
It's a brewery. In order to find out what they have available, you have to call. It's VERY odd.

WE GOT FOOD POISONING! My friend and I were passing through Downtown Charleston  and thought this place looked good. we both ordered tacos and spend the whole rest of the night throwing them up. We then had food poisoning for the next 24 hours. If you order tacos here MAKE SURE THEY ARE COOKED CORRECTLY.

Stopped for lunch, this restaurant has adequate seating for a party of 200! A fully stocked bar, bartender included! Wait staff is prompt and friendly. Dining area's appear clean and stocked with appropriate condiments. I ordered the barbacoa beef quesadillas and coke. The portion was plentiful, the barbacoa was extremely mild but flavorful. The choice of  cheese & flour tortilla complements the beef nicely.  On the side was a small portion of black beans mixed with corn an something else, it tastes like their take on pico "maybe". It was fresh and flavorful, excellent addition to the quesadilla. I requested a side of their salsa "no up charge". The salsa is prepared fresh, mild and packed with the flavor of authentic Mexican salsa! I was mildly impressed ☺. Coke was over iced, definitely ask for light ice. I scored them at 4 stars, solely on the price! My single quesadilla and coke was $13.50 before tip! I rate their price as 20% overvalued. However, I can see why they would need that additional 20%, their location and dining room size is what they are charging for in this instance. This would be a great restaurant to hold banquets, group lunches, celebrations etc. Honestly, Black sheep should market this highlight to bring in additional guests!!! Huge untapped growth potential!!! My opinion is the additional 20% cost is justifiable but unnecessary with further business development. To reiterate, I had a excellent dinning experience and will return in the near future! They do offer local delivery in the downtown area, I forgot to ask about any order minimums!

Enjoyed the beer, an IPA. Chicken burrito was OK, appeared to have little chicken and more beans. Wife's Thai Peanut with tofu was better. Located in downtown area, staff was good, we arrived about an hour before closing and just needed a quick bite. We found street parking fairly easily and just walked to the restaurant

name: Dem 2 Brothers And A Grill Bbq
address: 423 Virginia St W, Charleston, WV 25302, USA
reviews: Hands down, the best brisket I've had! Great smoke flavor, slightly crisp crust, and a fantastic rub...no need for any sauce. The ribs are amazing as well. The baked beans have the perfect amount of brown sugar, not too sweet...just a great flavor. This is a must stop for anyone in, or passing through, Charleston. I'm jealous that I live out of state and can't eat this regularly. I'm in town for another 5 days and will probably eat here 5 more times. As a bonus, BB King was playing the entire time I was eating. 👍

Best BBQ we've had possibly ever. We went on a roadtrip to Charleston and was looking for a good place that wasn't a chain restaurant.  We couldn't have been happier with our choice  great service and the best sauce I've ever had. It could make my shoe taste good  great brisket and chicken. Also the baked beans were a special treat.

The ribs had excellent  smoke flavor. I had asked for sauce to be on the side but instead they were on top. The wings were deep fried extra  crunchy. Sauces were a bit sweeter than I cared for. But the flavor of the meat made up for it

Overall, it was pretty good. We had a late lunch, so I'm a little more forgiving that the brisket was a little dry. The pork was also more shredded than pulled, but that also could've just been what was left at the end of lunch. The sauce was pretty tasty, and the beans were really good - almost too sweet to believe they were beans! The portions are pretty fair for what you pay and service is decent but not great. Lots of TVs, if you're trying to watch some football.
Neat inner city bbq joint. Flavoring was very good. Nice size portions. Great place to enjoy a cheap bbq platter.

name: Rio De Grill Brazilian Steakhouse
address: 3600 MacCorkle Ave SE, Charleston, WV 25304, USA
reviews: Rio De Grill has a reasonably priced lunch buffet that, if you have tiny children (under 5), is a real deal. The MEATS! Our youngest loves the 'pepper' (what he calls the prime rib). The garlic bread is worth the price of admission.

Great Service and Good Food. Endless meats. The pineapple and garlic bread were great. Looks like they are starting to update the decor. The flashing lights around the bar were alittle distracting along with the ribbon along the ceiling. It wasn't busy at all for a Friday Night. The chafing dishes could be shined up and bar refreshed. Overall a good experience and will definitely go back.

If you love meats then this is the place for you! The variety of steak, chicken, pork, and grilled pineapple are excellent. The cold bar I don't care for, I feel like they could have a better variety of things. Worth the money tho if you are a meat eater.

Great food at decent prices. Although it's a bit expensive, I would not say it's overpriced, especially for the prime rib, which is excellent! I would come here again. If you have a coupon it's even better!

We were there with a group of 10 or 12 for lunch a couple of days after Christmas. The wait staff handled our group with ease. They continually brought out different types of meat, which were all pretty tasty. The garlic bread was awesome. My only complaints are that I wish they had a better variety of foods on the buffet. Also, would be nice to have a better selection of dessert. Over all, it was a great experience, and I would eat there again.

name: The Block
reviews: Very fancy place with a more upscale clientele than the surrounding restaurants. The service was exceptional and very attentive. The prices are high as to be expected in a wine bar. The bartender was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and wine selection. However the Tapas Valencia we ordered was completely lacking in flavor and tasted almost like water. There was absolutely zero spice in the dish at all.

Beautiful restaurant with a great atmosphere. Enjoyed several appetizers (the pulled pork tator tots were way too good to stop for a photo), and was very impressed with the flavor of the lemon caper chicken I had for dinner. Dessert was just... heavenly! The waiters were attentive and knowledgeable, and ensured a good evening as well. I'm looking forward to returning soon!

Delicious food and nice atmosphere.
I definitely suggest getting the olives if you are an olive fan (they are seeded though so keep that in mind).
My wife and I had the salmon and scallops and both were fantastic!

Absolutely amazing restaurant.  A business buddy and I were in Charleston for the nite and this place was recommended by a local.  It is 100% as good as any restaurant in any major city of America.  Great wine list and wine steward and scrumptious food.  Loved the variety of choices and had a very hard time making a selection.

I will absolutely be eating at this restaurant again and again on my returns to Charleston.
Great cheese plate app and great burger. Lamb chops we're cooked perfectly. Not many bourbon house cocktails but it's a full bar with tons of wines and beers

name: Tidewater Grill
address: 1060 Charleston Town Center, Charleston, WV 25389, USA
reviews: Absolutely wonderful! The food was amazing and tasted just as good if not better than it was presented. The staff were very kind and welcomed us with suggestions and kindness. The food we well prepared and the seafood was excellent an fresh!! I would highly recommend giving them a chance to wow you!

This is over 2 trips. It feels little out of place or maybe because I'm not familiar with the area. The attempt to be a fresh seafood place is good. The seafood was actual very fresh but taste wise I think they fall a bit short. I wanted to going 3.5 stars. The servers a warm and welcoming. Thank you Chelsea for great service. It one of the better options available in the area.

Stopped here from out of town. Our waiter was extremely friendly and informative, and they were very accommodating to dietary needs/choices. Management staff was also walking around the restaurant throughout our meal. It was nice to see the hands-on approach.

This time at Tidewater I chose to dine at there elegant bar,however many times prior i have ate in the dining room with the wooden tables and fishery decor giving it a feel of a restaurant along the coast.
I chose a porter beer bottled from great lakes brewery and it was wonderful.
There menu is full of fish entree’s ... catch of the day, juicy steaks ,delicious chicken dishes and many more  items ...plus appetizers, salads and tantalizing deserts.
Something for everyones liking but my choice was the fish and chips which went perfect with my porter.
The generous crispy melt in your mouth fish, seasoned fries and deliciously crunchy hush puppies was absolutely perfect.
The bartender was there making sure i had ever thing i needed and was very attentive.
If you want to make a impression on someone ,take a loved one out or just treat yourself  to a exquisite dining experience then go to one of the best Restaurants in Charleston Wv 
 Tidewater Grill

Over priced with average service.  I have had better fish at Long John silvers.  Not sure how this place stays open.  Chili's and outback across the hall serve better food with more polite servers.  Not impressed.  My friend ordered a salad with her meal and everything she did not want was on it.  The prices are ridiculous, the atmosphere is loud and bar/grill style not a fine restaurant as they try to advertise.  Would never waste my money or time to return.  At the prices they charge customers should not have to wave down the server.

name: Tricky Fish
address: 1611 Washington St E, Charleston, WV 25311, USA
reviews: Very great tasting food at fantastic prices. The flavor was amazing! Will definitely visit again

I stopped in Charleston overnight looking for a local place with delicious food that didn't cost a fortune.  Tricky Fish filled the bill perfectly!   Friendly folks and delicious food at a reasonable price in a clean, quirky setting.   

Highly recommend the shrimp tacos with jerk seasoning.

Food was excellent, we had fish tacos and a basket of oysters.I had not been there for a long time.  However, in January in Charleston you need to have a little heat on.  It felt like a dirty abandoned house.  I am all for retro and openness but it really needs a good cleaning.

Had the catfish tacos.... very good... friendly staff.... we chose this place because they are pet friendly..... would have been 5 stars if the chairs were more comfortable. Will go back anytime I'm traveling through town again!

Recommended by a friend and now I can recommend to anyone else. Really bright atmosphere with an eclectic vibe that would make anyone comfortable. Not to mention the tacos that I scarfed so fast I didn't even have time to take a photo! You gotta go!

name: Main Kwong | Chinese Restaurant
address: 1407 Washington St E, Charleston, WV 25301, USA
reviews: Really great food. We stopped here on a road trip. If I lived close by this would be my go to chinese take out joint.
Amazing food! My favorite Chinese place to get take out and I will always recommend! Clean and friendly too.

The food I got there 2night was amazing. It was so good & hot & was so fresh. The eggfu young was awesome. The service was nice & friendly. They was very quick preparing my 2 go order. I will definitely b going back there again. The Best Chinese Food. That I Have Ever Had Period. !!!!!!!😋😋😋😋😋😋😋

I've been a customer for over 15 years. This is your basic Chinese cuisine you'd expect to find anywhere else. Everything is made fresh to order no worries about old food being served. But the quality is not the same anymore. My family used to order takeout every weekend as part of our family weekend tradition. Its just not there for me anymore. Staff is friendly but no wow factor in service. Food has become bland or overly greasy.

I originally come from an area in California that has a lot of Chinese people from mainland China and Taiwan. Outside of New York and California it's really hard to find really good Chinese food, even though even the stuff in California and New York is American Chinese food. I had to give this a five stars because it is the best Chinese food I have had outside of California and New York.

name: Plaza Maya
address: 3112 Chesterfield Ave B, Charleston, WV 25304, USA
reviews: Very good Mexican food of the many choices in the Charleston area. Everyone in my party was pleased with their entrees. Nice decor.

I wish I could rate this local business higher but I just can't. The two stars they have received are for some of the staff being 'kind' and their ability to accommodate large parties. The remaining stars are missing for several reasons. 

Firstly, the food. The food tastes cheap. While some of the dishes sound great on paper the execution is largely let down by the poor ingredients. My family often find ourselves here to give them another chance due to their ability to seat our extended family but they have continued to drop the ball. More often than not we return home and the majority of the family finds themselves sick. 

Secondly, the service. While some members of the staff are very helpful and effective waiters/waitresses the majority aren't attentive. They don't watch the tables and act like it's a chore to take care of the guests. When dealing with management it is apparent where this mindset stems from. 

I want to see this Kanawha City business find success but currently they aren't on the right path.

Great Mexican food. Fast and friendly service. I've hada quick lunch and a relaxing dinner there and it's good for both. Large portions and good selection. Can seat large groups but also had some cozy spots for just two. A great place in Charleston to grab a bite of Mexican food.
My first visit. The food was very good. It was hot too. Very friendly atmosphere. The restaurant is clean and comfortable seating too.

Loved the place. Unexpectedly good! The servings were big, the price was reasonable, and the food tasted great! The servers are really polite and helpful. Special shout out for the hot sauce! It is close to perfection!

name: Lola's Pizza
reviews:
It's OK. The food is good. But, I wish they were more generous with the toppings to make the price seem more palatable. 

The place is small, but very clean and pretty. My wife thought their gluten-free crust was the best she's had in this area. I tasted it and I could not tell the difference between that and regular crust.

They want you to drink alcohol, so the water glasses are tiny (see picture). They put their water to serve on these bottles that are too small. What's wrong with bigger pitchers with ice? Not everyone drinks alcohol or sodas.

Everything we had was delicious! The pizza was excellent. The veggie sandwich was delightful. Considering the freshness of the food, the prices were very reasonable. What I loved most was the "kids plate" for my son. Having the option of a healthy fruit, meat, and cheese plate was a welcome surprise compared to the standard kid's fare (mac & cheese, chicken tenders, or hot dogs). We will certainly be back soon!

Delightful designer pizza and other salad type things to eat plus wines and a wonderful white sangria!  We try to get there whenever we are in Charleston.  A bit difficult parking, one can always park up the hill and walk down to the restaurant.  Work off the food!

I've been dreaming of being here on the patio enjoying either a drink or a meal.  It far exceeded my expectations.  I can't wait to be back, and enjoy an evening beer on the patio.  Food was excellent, and very fairly priced.   Worth 6 Stars.
The food was very good and used fresh ingredients.  Part of our order was wrong, but corrected very quickly. Delicious and well plated.

name: Grazianos Pizza
reviews: Been going here since I was a kid. Love the pizza. Always consistent and taste great. Only thing I don’t like is an older woman that runs the register can be kind of rude. Not too welcoming. But she doesn’t bother me. I look past it because I enjoy the food so much

Ok. I had their pizza and wanted to try their lasagna and I finally had a change to go back and all I can say is great food at a great price. I paid about $12 for all of this... I know right!! Well come try it. 
Meat ball at the back.
Home made bread 
Pizza pepperoni 
Lasagna.

Listen, I used to live in Charleston and I ate at various family owned restaurants but NOBODY compares to Grazianos. They make their food with love and care. The food has that real Sicilian taste that makes you feel like you're eating in Sicily. Workers are friendly and professional and cares about your experience. They will always have my business.

When I call, the responders are pleasant and efficient. Delivery is prompt, the order is accurate, the food is fresh/hot, the delivery guys friendly and helpful. Graziano's is a solid and appreciated downtown Charleston business. I recommend the Sicilian salad.
Terrific New York-style pizza

name: The Chop House Charleston
address: 1003 Charleston Town Center, Charleston, WV 25389, USA
reviews: Took my mother here for her birthday. Great food (if a little too fussy for my style) and she loved it. The side portions are family style and none of us left hungry. I would take advantage of their weekend deals if going for a date night. I can appreciate the care in ingredient selection and it tells through the food. Overall good experience for my mom's birthday.

Exactly what we wanted and expected by a nice restaurant in the Charleston area. Our waiter was extremely nice, helpful, and a great person overall. Steak was phenomenal as was the cheesecake. Bourbon selection was not bad at all either.
Went for our 15th wedding anniversary. First time going, and will definitely go back. The staff is amazing,  only topped by their amazing menu.

The service was excellent. We ordered the Lobster bites as our appetizer which had decent size chunks of lobster. I ordered the Beef Wellington and was disappointed. The puff pastry was not very crispy and there was an odd sour taste in the layer between the filet and pastry.
I always feel like I’m in downtown NY when I eat here. Love the food,atmosphere and drinks. Me and my Husband go frequently.

name: Recovery Sports Grill
address: 600 Virginia St E, Charleston, WV 25301, USA
reviews:
Great sports bar with a HUGE set of TVs, so any game you want will probably be on. Add to that, the personal speakers at each table allow you to select the audio for the game you want. 

For food and drink, there's a great selection of craft beer on tap (Devil Anse IPA FTW!) and tasty bar food. 

Seriously, if you don't have a great man cave at home, this is a great option.

I love the Buffalo Chicken Wontons! The chicken tenders are a favorite dish for my wife who reports she has never had a bad meal here. Chicken is moist and the portion is large. 2 or 3 kids could easily share this plate.

Today, several of my co-workers and I had lunch here. It was my first time eating at Recovery. The server was excellent. There were 14 of us....big table! He was wonderful, very courteous and attentive. I had the Sizzling Cheesy Chicken dish. Delicious! I will definitely come back. The place was clean and very busy at the time we were there. Everything was great!

This is a very nice and large sports bar that is well maintained. It wasn't very crowded when we arrived however the service at the bar was still slow. The margarita was nice and refreshing on a hot day. The chicken tacos were so dry they were they hard to eat. Most likely pre-made chicken that was reheated to long? The draft beer I ordered had a layer of soapy ice float to the top which I couldn't drink. Probably the glass wasn't rinsed and dried properly before being frosted?  All places have a off day or period at times so I'll return in the future to give it another go.

Food was fantastic, very filling and came at a decent price too. Fun sports bar atmosphere inside, liked the green carpeted floors that reminded me of putt-putt/mini-golf. Large space inside, perfect for groups or other large parties, staff was pretty quick and attentive to our needs. Happy we chose to eat here while in Charleston!

name: Fazio's
reviews: It's not fair to the other places I've been to compare this review to those because tonight SHE was with me again and this is where we first met so I'm already taken with everything about this place. The service was consistently superb but truthfully I wouldn't have known of it was awful because all I could do was look at her and talk to her and pinch myself inside that we were here together again. She is so spectacularly wonderful and infinitely beautiful in every sense of the word both inside and out so you could not remove the joy off my face tonight with a chisel and a hammer. And so you begin to see why I love this place so. The meal was just delicious and the experience outstanding.

Waitress wasn't very attentive but she was nice.  Food priced a little higher than I would have expected, especially considering how old the building is.  Food was good and portion sizes normal.  We asked for oil for the bread and they charged us $1.50 for it without mentioning.  I'd give them a 3.5*. I eat there every other Black Friday dinner (once every 2 years) and this was my 4th time there.
It sure is an institution in Charleston. My family has been coming here my whole life. My mother even says she came here as a youngster. I am a veal lover and they do veal really, really good here.
Excellent as always

Our tennis doubles group went to Fazio's for a family dinner. They were very welcoming and have an extensive menu. We had a great waiter and enjoyed delicious meals while visiting for nearly 3 hours - no rush. Thanks for your hospitality Fazio's!

name: Bricks & Barrels
reviews: Went for a work dinner and really liked it! The atmosphere is peaceful and intimate, with a beautiful interior design. The cocktails were delicious (slightly strong - but not complaining!) and the food was also great. I got the parmesan encrusted chicken with risotto and asparagus. There was enough for me to take home for lunch for the next day, and it still tasted just as good! The strawberry shortcake I had for dessert was possibly the best I've had! Definitely would recommend.

Great ambience, as well as tasty food. My only complaint was there was no appetizers offered outside of having to buy an appetizer. Thus resulting in being slightly less than completely full at the end of our meals. This could have been easily avoided if something small was offered to guest free of charge, such as bread and butter or chips and a dip for example. I feel as if you buy two 45 dollar steaks, the appetizer should come with it. Otherwise good food and a nice atmosphere. 👍

Had a overall wonderful experience for a New Years Eve dinner with the family.  They were able to accommodate a large group.  Wait staff were attentive and on point, even with the large group.  They offered a special meal with both wine and bourbon pairings which were excellent.  Only criticism would be over the wife's scallops on her surf and turf, they were cold and rubbery.  Will definitely be back.

Experiences have been too mixed and too unreliable to recommend. Calamari is always very nice, but hardly 5 star.  Linguine with seafood was very rich and tasty, scallops were done perfectly and normally I stay away from them. Despite this, we had written off Bricks and Barrels years ago due to consistent and stunning shortcomings for such high prices, like a $45 australian lamb that ended up being four nuggets on ribs, with so much fat they were inedible. That's $11.25 per nugget. They also seem to have a delusional obsession with reservations; we were twice turned away even though the place was mostly open. On one of those occasions we just had appetizers at the bar and the place never even close to filled up. The private barrels are cozy if you can get one, even though they're not taken, as a former restaurant host, that's like burning money. The decor is nice and rustic, but the glass top barrel tables end up being too awkward to sit at for long, and shouldn't lean on them.  So we went one last time more out of reckless abandon even though we reviewed their disappointments on the way. We again could not get any open table, sat at the bar with good beer selection, but and were served pints not even close to filled, did ask for them to be topped off, but our moment of trust was already punished with this "beertrayal", so we did not stay for dinner or even another round. This can be a problem with places serving too much head and skimping on the beer, so yes, I have this gauge, but I think this is a record low pour. I really wanted this to work... never again.

We reserved a barrel, which we were assured was confirmed, only to find out we would not be eating in one. The hostess informed us that waiting for one would be a couple of hours (someone was sat in one the first 15 minutes we were there). A couple people wanted burgers, which we were then told that they weren't doing "handheld items" this weekend. The service was absolutely horrible. Honestly our waitress acted like she couldn't have cared less. Food took forever, along with anything else we needed. I ordered the seafood alfredo, and the pasta came out cold. It was disgusting. For the price you pay for this food, I expect more, and so should anyone else. And if you reserve a barrel, you should get a barrel. I'm glad I didn't show my disappointment while I was there, because from the sound of these remarks from the owner, they enjoy being sarcastically caring, and don't really care if people are displeased. This establishment will not last. Save your money and go elsewhere.

name: Quaker Steak & Lube
reviews: I would not come back here if they paid me. I’ve been to other locations so I know to expect, at best, about 3.5-star food. This location is 1-star operated. Apparently, even with five people at times, they can’t handle the simple task of managing the seating. I went as a party of three.  Twenty minutes later, they took a walk-in party of four ahead of me. During the enlightening wait for a table, I saw someone seated when first walked in had barely received any attention anyway. I saw servers and managers milling about the front desk during their peak time. If you value your time, go elsewhere. There are plenty of options in this area.

Great place to eat for good prices. Tried the new Top Sirloin today; it was amazing, and only $12.99! Fast, courteous service with a smile. Always a favorite of mine for lunch, dinner, or a fun night out!

Fantastic food, fantastic service.   Had a group of 16.   Speedy and everything was right the first time.  Tommy was our server and went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied.   Definitely be back.

This wing establishment is well known and this location is what you would expect if you have been to any other in PA. The wings are awesome. I don’t usually vary from ordering the wings because this is why you should come. The pic is the Louisiana sauce. Add some Tabasco and beer and that is it for me. This place has been around or a long time so the locals know it. If you are staying next door at the Hampton, stop by.

Last time we went, the waitress wasnt friendly, my dad's order was messed up and it took talking to the manager to get it straightened out and still ended up over paying. Food was okay but some of it seemed old. Or like it was cooked out of order. We probably wont be back for a while which is sad because the one in my hometown is great and I miss the food. But this experience was not worth it.

name: Mi Cocina de Amor
reviews: Best Mexican in Charleston. The food never disappoints and the service is great.
Really great Mexican food in an authentic atmosphere. The fish tacos are especially good, and the chips with queso are good. The enchiladas are good, but the cheese seemed wrong - was it cheddar?

Lovely restaurant nestled in Charleston”s west side. You are greeted warmly as you enter and treated like family throughout your dining experience. This restaurant has a beautiful atmosphere, generous portions,, friendly staff, and delicious cuisine.  I give this restaurant my highest recommendation.
Best Tacos I’ve ever had!  Always great food and friendly service. Can’t go wrong.

I don’t know how or why this place has such great reviews. It was nothing but a joke. Do not recommend. Thankfully their other restaurants is phenomenal, Gonzoburger, it seems like they stopped caring for this place

name: Suzi's Hamburgers
address: 239 MacCorkle Ave SW, South Charleston, WV 25303, USA
reviews: Use to love their biscuits with cheese dripping off them. Got one this morning and once again  Its like they put it on and then wipe it off.  I rather pay even more for the biscuit then I already do to add cheese. To be able to taste it and for  it not to be so dry!

Loved this place and wish it was in my home city! No frills simple breakfast with a HUGE biscuit and tasty gravy at a very affordable price. Very busy the entire time I Was there. Would not recommend for folks that like pretentious barn wood/edison light foodie places, but if you want a filling and tasty breakfast you need to go here.
Just driving through, but so very happy we stopped here! Best sweet tea I have had in years! And the cheeseburger and fries were amazing. But, the sweet tea 😍

THE girls working today were wonderful.  Loved the cashier Kaley was very personable.  Great cashier.  The cheeseburger was very tasty.  Like home made.  The beef tasted fresh.  Clean restaurant and fast service.  Ok so down falls only sauce available was ketchup , mustard , mayo and hot sauce.  They had no slaw either.  The frys tated good but was thin cut.  Which is cool if you like that type.  The price was decent as well.  The fried apple pie was not something I personally would do again.   So I give this restaurant a 3 or of 5  all over.  Service alone I could have done a 5 and the burger alone a 4.5 . So if your in the area stop in and try.  I've also been told breakfast is wonderful from other guests....

Great food. You get a lot for your money. Very busy place, they are staffed up and handle the crowds very well.  Within walking distance from Joe Holland Hyundai. We were able eat breakfast while our car was getting worked on.

name: Chick-fil-A
reviews:
My recent visit to Chick -fil- A was very good. The staff was pleasant and friendly. We got our orders quickly.
This is the first time that I have had breakfast at  Chick -fil-A. I ordered a bacon egg and cheese muffin with tater tots. The sandwich was good and I was surprised that the tater tots weren't greasy at all.
The restaurant was clean and well maintained.
I will definitely return when I am in the area.
I will give them a big thumbs up!

The WORST experience I’ve ever had at a Chick fil a in the 6 years that this Chick Fil A has been here. I got into the drive thru line at 10:18am and waited until 10:31am to get into the line where they take your order. I asked if they were still serving breakfast and the woman said “No they just called it” I then said I’ve been in line since 10:18am and she said “Sorry but they won’t make any more breakfast back there” and I can’t even leave because the line is so long that I can’t reverse out of the drive thru. This wasn’t a problem in years prior to this. I have came to the drive thru at 10:31am before and it was fine. This just ruined my whole morning.

My husband and I had breakfast and it was such a wonderful experience. The food was wonderful but most of all the staff. They are above and beyond. They are so polite. Thank you! You guys are the best. Merry Christmas.🎄

This place is Awesome!  They employee a lot of West Virginians.  You can tell the work environment is great.  Our food was ready before we left the counter even though the place was packed.  I will go back to the South Ridge Chic Fil A
I honestly just come here when someone else wants to. Food is usually ok. But not excellent or perfect. Kids like the play room. They need more space for handicapped seating inside.

name: Chow Thai
address: 426 1/2 B Shrewsbury St, Charleston, WV 25301, USA
reviews: Chow Thai is one of the best restaurants in Charleston, WV. The food is outstanding and the customer service is wonderful. Highly recommend giving them a try whether you have time to sit down or you are on a time crunch and takeout. Also, Charleston 2 Go provides delivery service for them so if you can't make it to their downtown location you can have Chow Thai delivered right to your door at home. We try to eat there at least once a week because it is just that good. You won't be disappointed.
One of the few Thai place in Charleston. Menu is simple but most of the dishes are tasty. Recommend the Thai tea and Panang curry

Great place to eat and very tasty and delicious. Plates came out very clean and food was displayed excellent. Inviting and comforting atmosphere. WARNING:the spice levels are hot, i like decently spicy food but medium was a little hot so try no spice if you cant handle spicy foods.

This place is a little tricky to find, but it's worth the effort. Small dining room with about 10 tables. Friendly and helpful staff. The food is fantastic. The wife gets Pan Kee Mao with chicken, I get Massaman Curry Chicken with fried rice. Both are very good. Food is always very fresh and hot. Anything above "Little spice" is quite spicy, but I go up to "medium spice" because I like a kick to my food. Price is very reasonable for the quality and service. We eat here a couple times per month.

I arrived just before closing today and mentioned this was my first time there and asked for a curry recommendation.  The young lady recommended their C4, Chiang Mai noodles with chicken.  It was an amazing dish.  The taste is awesome.  I will be back.

name: Nosh Catering & Carryout
reviews: The place is tiny, but adorable. I know it's a carryout place but if you manage to snag a table I recommend eating in for the servers are lovely and friendly folks! It's a little pricey for two of us it was about 30$. I personally had the philly chicken and fruit water with chocolate cake and it was delicious!
I love the food here!  The BLT Smoked Salmon is the best thing on Earth, until Thursday. Thursday the have Monte Cristo. AAUGH love it!
Everything I've had  at this restaurant has been EXCELLENT
Beautifully decorated, great atmosphere, friendly staff and delicious food. My 9 year old is still talking about how delicious his grilled cheese was. Will definitely be back.

Great food!  Great people!  I had their shrimp tacos. My friends got Chef salad, Poboy and grilled cheese. For desert my friend got the bread pudding which he said was outstanding.  Located on the East End, check them out!

name: Swiftwater Café
reviews: Swiftwater Cafe rocks! Its food is fantastic; owner and staff are good down home folks that run a great little business with way better food than large chains do! We were visiting in from the Northern Panhandle of WV and just stopped in. Will definitely recommend and be back on our way through again! Thank you Swiftwater! :)
Nice little downtown cafe. Fast service and very nice staff. The breakfast was good standard fair of eggs and meats. We enjoyed the fish on the wall too.
they have the best fried potatoes around. good place for breakfast. fast and reasonable.
Nice place and good food. I have went there many times while working in the area
Tasty burgers on Wednesday and Friday.

name: LongHorn Steakhouse - Curbside To Go Available
reviews: My husband and I love to split the Outlaw ribeye. It’s delicious and large enough to easily split. Look for their draft specials and they make a good Old Fashion. Service was incredible the evening we were there.

Food and service was great. Steaks to perfection.  Waitress was extremely courteous and very pleasing to accommodate our wishes ang questions.
I had as a salad with my steak the strawberry  fruit pecan salad.  Best ever had. We will return.

It is pricey! Aside from that, the food is so-so. Once I ordered a steak which was good (expensive, but good). Another time I ordered the salmon but it was so, SO fishy I ate a couple bites and had to bring the rest home to give to my cats. The atmosphere and wait staff are nice, but you can find better food at a better price elsewhere.

Absolutely my favorite steakhouse chain. The food is always above my expectations and the service is generally spot on. My drinks have very seldom been below half a glass. Also the decor makes for a very Western experience that lacks in competing chains. The price is fair for the quality food and service provided.

I love just wished they didn't leave the check as they set the food down for the main meal. I think this must be a company training policy thing because every location does it to me. I feel like they are going to to forget to come back and give me more drink because I always drink a pitcher of water at each meal. Plus Everytime they do that they knocked themselves out of us getting dessert and a bigger tip.

name: Nawab Fine Indian Cuisine
reviews: Staff was attentive but not overbearing, food was very good, prepared well, and typical of Indian restaurants. A good option for Indian cuisine in the area!
The staff is friendly and helpful. Food was so tasty. Large variety on the buffet. Great way to try new things.

Nothing to beat Nawab in Charleston. Have been to other indian restaurants in Charleston and I must say Nawab is light years ahead and I hope it serves the same great taste and quality in the coming years! We had awesome food and hospitality whenever we go there. Kudos and keep up! You are the best in Charleston!

Food was very good.  Excellent value for the price, and good service too.  Every single thing I tried at the bar was delicious.  If there was ANY complaint it would be there were a few older Naan up at the bar that were not fresh, but I was there after lunch hour.  But thats being very picky.  Will be back again and again.
Went for monday buffet. The place, people and food were amazing. Good pitstop in west Virginia.

name: Brick Salt Bar+Kitchen
address: 200 Lee St E, Charleston, WV 25301, USA
reviews: Great restaurant. We came here because we were staying at the Marriott. Drink prices are reasonable.
Was there for breakfast as I was staying there.  Had the buffet  pretty much the same as in every hotel but you had to pay 14.   Really much for what it was

Great Food and Service! This hotel bar and restaurant had the best grilled chicken ceasar salad I have ever had and if you only knew my addiction to this particular dish you would know that is saying something! The room service menu paralleled this menu and that service was outstanding as well.  I highly recommend this bar and restaurant anytime of the day or night for a quick bite or full dinner. The Moscow mule was also top notch!👍🏻

Fantastic food and service.   I fully recommend Paula at the bar.  She’s very attentive and a gorgeous gorgeous smile.  I had the blackened catfish.  I lived a long time in the south and this catfish was terrific.  Really really good.  Highly recommend

Another great dinner at a place that much of Charleston has not yet discovered. The Shrimp and sausage with pasta in a deliciously spicy red sauce was superb. Good service and nice metro ambiance eating in the lounge area

name: Sitar of India
address: 702 Lee St E, Charleston, WV 25311, USA
reviews: Nice place to get Indian buffet. The manager and staff were genuinely good people. Recommend it, if you are in Charleston and looking for good Indian food. Good vegetarian options.

Words can’t describe how excellent this was. Even doing takeout, the ensured hospitality was displayed. Not to mention the food was packaged and prepared flawlessly. 

I can’t believe it took me this long to discover this place.

The Sitar is a good one and has been around for maybe 20 yrs. I stopped by this evening for takeout and they did it up right. We have an Indian population in town so they don't "dumb it down" for the American palate. As said, this is a good one.
First time ordering from here. Outstanding food! I'm just passing through the area but would definitely come back if in the area again.
Great place to eat! I like how they have different options from day to day. Staff is very personable and ready to accommodate.

name: Cozumel Méxican Restaurant | Corridor G
reviews: Delicious food! My husband and I went for Valentine's Day dinner. They were pretty busy. However, they were prompt and checked on us frequently. We don't come to Charleston often, but would undoubtedly eat here again the next time we are in town.

Wendy is THE BEST waitress...  NEVER  a bad meal. Always clean. No Mexican restaraunt in the state measures up to It!!! 2 locations can be found..... Ashton place shopping area and St. Albans near old rivers edge restaraunt.  Most authentic Mexican flavors I have ever had. We will ALWAYS go there for mexican°

Cozumel is a fantastic place to eat. If you enjoy good Mexican food this is the place to get it. If you appreciate a friendly attentive waitress eat here.if you enjoy life entertainment while you're having your meal this is the place to go. With the authentic Mexican decor and widescreen TVs I would recommend Cozumel to anyone passing through South Charleston.
When I was ready to leave my waitress made sure I had all the necessary containers to take my leftovers with me. A bag for the chips a cup for the salsa a go-cup for my drink and a handy box for the remainder of my tasty fajita.
Quick to serve, great drinks, fantastic food!! Love the atmosphere and the staff! That cozumel dip just doesn't quit! 😋

This place is actually kind of tasty. But unfortunately I cannot call this a Mexican restaurant as I am from San Diego and I've had real Mexican food. However the atmosphere is great, the people that take care of your orders are always very friendly, the outside serving area is actually nice when it is hot outside, and they are very expedient when it comes to taking drink orders. I came here for a going away party for one of my fellow coworkers and they made sure that everything was taken care of a hundred percent while we were there. No questions asked I would definitely recommend going here.

name: Smokehouse
address: 1549 W Washington St, Charleston, WV 25387, USA
reviews:
They are slow when you go in but they are exceptionally slow when you were picking up. We waited over 50 minutes for 1/2 club sandwich. I checked on it twice in person, and the third time I called because there were people at the crowded front door who were not wearing masks, including a Dunbar police officer. But then they told us it was ready and would bring it right out. We knew there was one car ahead of us but 4 others we're at the front door besides those of us waiting in our cars. 
  After 8 more minutes (total= 56 minutes) after not seeing anyone, we left. If the sandwich really had been ready and sitting there, it as well as the fries, would have been soggy. We would never have left Cross Lanes. Had they told us it was going to be over an hour and still not receive a simple sandwich we would have come back when they were better prepared.
Great food great prices! Comfort food at its best.
Location is not the best area.  Food is amazing tho. Nice, friendly staff. Good community atmosphere
Best wait staff in Charleston!  We often go for breakfast and are never disappointed!  Our one place to eat breakfast in Charleston that never disappoints! A+!

I'm going to go with the overall environment and conversations and food here. The environment is very chill. They have a dinning area, bar,  pool hall and gambling area. The employees are very welcoming and friendly. I ordered the Ruben and fried mushrooms. The Ruben was so fresh and enjoyable but the mushrooms tasted like they had freezer burn and then cooked. I couldn't eat them. I will soon visit again and do an update. 🙂

name: Ristorante Abruzzi
reviews: The food was excellent, with both moderate prices and more expensive. Half a dozen specialty cocktails (I had the Godfather, whisky and amaretto), a variety of wines and a so-so beer selection. We were celebrating a birthday and staff went out of their way to accommodate us.
Excellent service and food selection. Enjoyed the New Years Eve special of stuffed flounder. Others at the table order pasta dishes which were stated as delicious.
Amazing food and wonderful service.  Tremendous restaurant!

FANTASTIC!!! Everything was fresh and wonderful from the appetizers to the entree’s to the desserts! The new chef has out done himself with great flavors and amazing dishes. The owners and the chef have created that Italian homemade meal experience. Charleston’s next top restaurant!!!

As a former employee of Riatorante Abruzzi I can say that they are a very good resteraunt. The talent in the kitchen is unbelievable, they have some of the finest chefs I've ever met who truly put passion into their food and take pride in what they serve to customers. The wait staff is also very excellent, they have very friendly and well trained servers who will make sure your dining experience is as perfect as it can possibly be. On top of all of that they have very friendly owners who listen to customer feedback and ensure you thoroughly have a good experience.

10/10 if you ever want to take your significant other out for a luxurious night or want to stop by for a well cooked meal this is the place for you.

name: Ichiban | Pan-Asian Cuisine
reviews: I really appreciated the cleanliness of this restaurant. Our bartender was very sweet with a great attitude. It is quite pricey for the size of the portions you receive. I'm not much into sushi but I'm always into trying places that are new to me. The smoked salmon had a slight grayish tint to it instead of pink? My date loved hers so I'll go with her opinion since she loves sushi. The service was spot on with a attentive staff.

This is the best Sushi in WV.  The quality for the last 10yrs has been outstandingly consistent.  I love those bearded Sushi Chefs.  The  bartender  makes an amazing Old Fashioned.  We have too many memories here to share in one review.
Matt and Caleb are making the sushi with love!! The sushi is beautifully crafted and don't go in looking for cheap sushi rolls beacuse you won't fond it here! Totally worth it!
This restaurant never fails to deliver! Every bite was on point from the appetizer to the salad to the entree to that lucious chocolate cake. Perfect way to celebrate an anniversary!!

A great restaurant in the heart of downtown Charleston which offers cocktails from the classic Old Fashion and Manhattan to the uniquely asian-inspired green tea martini. The  is phenomenal and prepared by local legend, Chef Evan. From presentation to taste and texture, the sushi and sashimi are the highest quality and presented with culinary flair. Be warned that prices are above average, but understand that the restaurant uses the highest quality ingredients and the size of the restaurant limits the number of daily patrons. Our friends Julie and Keith were thoroughly impressed as well.

name: Los Amigos Méxican Restaurant
reviews: Food was the best Mexican I have ever had. Price was perfect for the amount of food you receive. The server was amazing. We had a all around great experience and will definitely be making plans to come back!
Food was excellent.  Portions were great.  And the staff was incredibly nice to me.
Friendly staff, love the color and decor, love these two desserts!
Best Mexican food I have had in years.  The chunky guacamole is nice.

Super nice people, great food. Service has always been fast. Lots of parking space, away from busy traffic. Good place to ring friends and have a leisurely time. Order a Margarita. A second Margarita? No! You need to make it back home, remember?

name: The Grill
address: 117 W Washington St, Charleston, WV 25302, USA
reviews: A West Side institution! The place to get good home cooked meals and friendly familiar hospitality. GREAT burgers, wings, hot dogs, and daily specials like fried chicken with mashed potatoes and green beans.
Local greasy spoon with lots of character and characters. Tried out the cheeseburger and fries and they did not disappoint. Definitely want to go back and try out  more of the menu.
Best fried bologna sammy! Cant go wrong with the hot dogs or burgers either, fantastic hospitality and food.
I ate a delicious garden salad. Everything was fresh. The unsweetened ice tea was very refreshing.
I absolutely love this place! They have the most delicious food and even better people there to take care of you. Their taco dogs are amazing.

name: Chin's Restaurant
address: 4114 MacCorkle Ave SE, Charleston, WV 25304, USA
reviews: Excellent locally family owned. Serving authentic dishes with large portions. Come hungry!

They are charging a 15% service charge on all orders.  No explanation why other than what’s going on.  Taking advantage of the current situation.  Price gauging at urs finest.  Will never eat here again.

I may have already reviewed Chin's, but since I was asked, I will say it again. This restaurant is a MUST. Everything is fresh. Everything I've tried is wonderful, and I've been all over the menu. Soups, original egg rolls, Rangoon, main dishes; it doesn't matter. You'll find each superior to similar dishes (but not exact) offered at the typical Chinese take out establishment. Unlike the typical, Chin's is unique, with recepies handed down along with a superb dedication to service. Go. Try anything ( and I HIGHLY recommend the Tahitian Chicken). Enjoy.
Egg rolls not cooked, pineapple chicken was awful, a breaded chicken patty sliced  with a few pieces of pineapple and a small container of rice.
Great food made me feel like I was back in California will be back one of the best in Wv

name: Outback Steakhouse
address: 1062 Charleston Town Center, Charleston, WV 25389, USA
reviews: We ate here late one Saturday night between 8 and 9. It wasn't busy at all. To be honest we thought it might be a sign of things to come. But... We were pleasantly surprised. Steak was cooked just right. Ribs were falling off the bone.  Crisp green leafy salad and a hot blooming onion. Server was exceptionally nice and was deserving of a good tip. Great experience. For a downtown restaurant, they do close early though for a weekend.

Our service was excellent! Courtney was our server and she did an outstanding job. The restaurant was very busy, we had to wait an hour just to get seated, but it was worth the wait. The food tasted amazing!

Outback has gone so downhill.  My steak was overcooked and fatty.   My "lobster tail" was the size of a large shrimp and overcooked..  I used to love Outback but it has cut costs and become mediocre at best.  Service was fine though.  Bartender was very nice and helpful.   Not worth the  money at all anymore
In the middle of a Whole30 while traveling.  Waitress was helpful and patient working with me to make sure my meal would be compliant.  Food was great too.

Everything was prepared well as usual. I would not recommend the steak and shrimp version of the Queensland Pasta, as the cut of steak used is very chewy. If you do order it, eat the steak separately, rather than on the same fork as your pasta, otherwise you will end up needing to swallow pasta while still struggling with the chewy steak.

name: Sam's Uptown Café
reviews: I really do love small local bars with joyful local crowds. The prices here are slightly lower than the bars and restaurants around it. The bartender and staff were awesome and allows you to customize your food order to your liking. The pastrami sandwich was delicious and quite large. The homemade potato chips are a complete game changer that I'm still thinking about! This is a must stop place to visit in Charleston.

This is one of those restaurants where you really want to know how they make their food so you can recreate it at home. It's that good! They never fail to get the order right and the food is delicious. A go to spot for lunch in downtown Charleston with fair prices, great service and delicious food.

Great food in a casual, social environment with a mixed crowd. Gravy is always great, and so are most menu items. A little overpriced for bar food, but you definitely get what you pay for. The location is good if you’re near, and parking is okay if you know what you’re doing. Service is usually good depending on the times. Either way, food comes out hot and delicious. Would recommend.

Went in for the Game of Thrones themed brunch. Very creative. Was the first brunch I've been to there. All of our food was great. I had steak and eggs and my friends went with the Lazy Dragon (alligator). I didn't get any of the alligator but it looked fantastic. Won't be my last trip to Sam's. Was a little slow getting food and service but overall very good. Gravy was excellent.

I wish I could honestly review higher. Maybe my second try will be better. The staff were nice but took 10 minutes to even acknowledge me. The food came out but covered in grease. I would try again but with hesitancy.

name: Bistro at the Barge
address: 1414 MacCorkle Ave SW, Charleston, WV 25303, USA
reviews: Order appetizers. They can be large enough for one, and even if one eats two, you can get it for an excellent price. The prices are lower than one would expect for an upscale restaurant like itself. Once again, my best suggestion for keeping prices low is ordering appetizers and eating them as small plates or tapas. On another note, the desserts and cocktails are lovely. Great atmosphere- the tables are MASSIVE, and, you know, looking at a moonlit river is always beautiful.

Absolutely Fantastic! The raw oysters for the appetizer were perfectly prepared with a citrus and shallot topping.  For the entree, I had the sea scallops.  They were super tender, crisp golden brown top and bottom served on a bed of risotto in a light creamy sauce.

The Bistro at the Barge is a great destination formal dinner.  It is a hidden gem, that you will have to really look closely at the signs to find.  The restaurant was recently reopened, after being closed for four years due to the owner passing away.  You can try to swing in and catch an open table, but reservations are a must for dinner.

During the warmer months the lower level of the restaurant, Barge Restaurant Bar & Grill, is open for lunch and dinner, with river front seating right on the water.  

This is a restaurant with a rich history and some of the best food on the east coast.  Whether you stop in for riverside lunch in the summer or a 5-star worthy formal dinner year-round , you will not be disappointed.
Outrageous prices, mediocre food, decent service. $117 for 6 of us to eat bar food and 3 beers. That's just too much to pay to sit on the river to eat bar food.
I thoroughly enjoyed it. Very relaxing.
The favorite place in Charleston to eat.

name: Aladdin Restaurant
reviews: Very disappointed.  I ordered a well done strip steak.  It was literally bleeding, not even medium rare.  The cheapest bottled ranch dressing, a dry, overcooked chicken breast on my ceasar salad, mediocre baked potato, spinach dip that tasted like it came out of a can.  Wine that tasted like the cork it was so old.  Waitress not attentive or friendly at all.
Best rack of lamb ever
Great local restaurant. Hearty portions, low prices, for quality food.
I liked the food very tasty  and nice service...I recommend it in this city😋

Superb food. We were a group of 6 and all felt the same about our meals. They were minus several of the wines on their list but after 3 tries,the 4th selection was quite good. So good in fact that we ordered a second bottle. When selecting veggies ask for options. The mushrooms were delicious. Good place to meet friends and talk. We were never rushed. Great dining experience.

name: Leonoro's Spaghetti House
address: 1507 Washington St E, Charleston, WV 25311, USA
reviews: Been to different countries and at least 20 states, and Leonoro's has the best meatballs in the world. I will drive hours just to pick some up. Amazing!
My favorite place to get Italian in town! Wonderful food, and amazing service! Highly recommend!
Their specialty is spaghetti and meatballs.  The best I have eaten.  The favorite restaurant of three generations of my family.
A staple of the community for over a 100 years. The way your momma would make pasta and gravy.
Good home made food at down home prices. Very good service too.

name: Wheelhouse
reviews: If you have not experienced the "Wheelhouse",what are you waiting on!!!!  This Lake Erie west shore resident would come back to Charleston's "Wheelhouse" for the chicken salad alone!!!!!
My girl friend likes it their..
Great food large portions
ALWAYS SO CLEAN! Amazing fresh food, daily specials, fast and friendly service. I have never been disappointed. Its my new favorite place to grab a bite to eat.
Fantastic food, friendly staff, clean, and great prices.

name: Super Weenie
reviews: Very cheap hot dogs that taste great and will definitely fill you up. Excellent place for lunch.
Best hot dogs I had in Charleston! Please come and try them out if visiting, you will not be disappointed. Although there are not sitting tables, the food is delicious and fresh

Intriguing menu that I wish I could explore more, but I live out of town. I went with the standard WV Dogs because that's the gold standard in West Virginia, if you can't get those right around here you're doomed! I was impressed. They were well put together and not extremely sloppy. Service was quick and very friendly. The place has a neat vibe and it should be on your list when you're visiting downtown Charleston!
Great, quick, no frills hot dog place. I'm picky about my chili, and I loved theirs. Many delicious selections. I will definitely be coming back!

It is always an excellent experience going to Super Weenie. I am glad they now have a year round store front to stop by. While it does get busy, it is always worth the wait. The team is great at making sure my food is excellent.

name: Fujiyama Japanese Steakhouse
address: 5780 MacCorkle Ave SE, Charleston, WV 25304, USA
reviews: This has been the VERY first place I've ever been to that has made "Sushi" they way it's supposed to be made... I'm so pleased! The fish is soooooo fresh and delicious... The seaweed is so crisp, it snaps in your mouth... Also, they don't skimp on the fish either like other restaurants do when making the Sushi... The are the BEST HANDS DO... I have my new favorite place to go! Keep.up the amazing word...
Wait staff is always nice and quick with your food. Best place to eat in Kanawha City.

Very good sushi and entrees. I perfer table service over hibachi, but would recommend against large group table service and suggest hibachi in that situation. Courses often drag with table service for large groups. No one eats at the same time.

Everything else is aces.
Hot green tea and miso soup were just how they should be. "Rock n roll" roll was delicious. Eel roll was also very good. Great eel sauce. Waitress was very polite and prompt.
Wonderful food. Will definitely go back!

name: Las Trancas Mexican Restaurant
address: 121 Cross Terrace Blvd #9461, Charleston, WV 25309, USA
reviews: Love the food and the people here! Everyone is super friendly. Make sure when you go in to ask for Amy! She is my favorite server & does an outstanding job every time.
Great Mexican food, rest chips and great salsa. Oh and great sweet tea.

If you like unseasoned soggy food, then go ahead. Was very disappointed when this place was recommended to me. Literally no flavor, and covered with lettuce, and a single thin slice of tomato, and watery refried beans. Guess it's the Charleston Palate.

Very good food and large portions for a reasonable price. The unique features and high ceiling make for a notable atmosphere and the staff are friendly and attentive. Been coming here for nearly a decade and admire the consistency of the food. Also, the manager is amazing and does his job very well.

I had trouble finding a menu on internet so I have taken pictures for everyone else having the same trouble.  My visit was a early lunch dinner. 
The waiter had a little  trouble understanding what I was asking . Which not a big deal at all.  
Pretty empty I must have hit a sweet spot because every other time I have had to wait forever even if it was lunch time. 
Great service . Friendly staff . Cold drinks.  I would recommend this place for anyone looking for good Mexican food.

name: Giovanni's Pizza
reviews: Tried to order delivery. Was informed that they are not taking delivery orders because they are closing in 20 minutes (I thought they closed at 11, which would be an hour and 20 minutes) Anyway she said they had 3 or 4 orders ahead of me and aren't interested in taking more. Ok 👌

At the recommendation of a co-worker, I tried Giovanni's cauliflower crust pizza and it was much better than I expected. I've tried making cauliflower crust pizzas before, but they never turned out anywhere near as good as this. I highly recommend this if you're doing keto or just want to try something new. You won't regret getting the cauliflower crust pizza!
My food is always wonderful! I usually pick up on the way home because delivery times can be long. I think this is much better since they've added GrubHub and a few secondary delivery services.
Service is always good....the provolone cheese makes the pizza special....i recommend the pepperoni pounder...image included
Food was fabulous! The young guy working the register was very polite but could use some more training. He forgot our chips and another customers water.

name: China Buffet
address: 5707 MacCorkle Ave SE, Charleston, WV 25304, USA
reviews: I love going here with my family. The atmosphere is great. Food was delicious and the staff was so kind. They always have fresh food out. There deserts are amazing. I would recommend going here.
Food was OK. Nothing special for sure. Selection is adequate but the food that I actually got didn’t taste the best and I got a pretty good variety. Food was fresh but egg rolls weren’t very crispy.
I love this place. I have NEVER had a bad experience dinning their. The food is always fresh & good .
Great food great price and the friendliest wait staff and managers around here. Keep up the good work David it's always a great comfortable experience their.
the place is clean  the staff is friendly awesome taste I truly recommend

name: Soho's
reviews:
The service at Soho's was excellent! The staff is very friendly and the waiter's timing to stop by and check on our table was perfect. 

My food review is based on a soup of the day crab bisque and the meatball sandwich. I personally didn't love the food, but I would return again to try something else.

I grew up in Maryland, so I have a certain palette expectation for crab vegetable soup versus crab bisque. The crab bisque at Soho's was a combination of the two - a very heavy tomato sauce base without much cream or butter and I did not detect Old Bay. So as much as I enjoyed the soup, it felt lacking personally in the creaminess of a bisque.

The meatball sandwich has a beautiful presentation, but I had to squish the meatballs down to even attempt to eat it as a sandwich. The meatballs really should be smaller with more of them. The meatballs themselves had a texture that was super smooth and I personally prefer a but more mouthfeel to meatballs. The sauce was excellent. The bread was crusty and delicious, but hard to enjoy because of the overly sized meatballs. The cheese was fine, but should have been melted because it did not pull apart easily.

I wish the side was not chips. The chips held too much oil in them though they were crunchy. 

Again, I would return to try something else on the menu because the food was pretty good, but I wouldn't recommend this particular sandwich.
Great service,  great food... the vegetarian lasagna is my favorite... so tasty and unusual!  Great atmosphere too.

Almost heaven :) the food is very good and the atmosphere is also nice. Nevertheless, the prices are a bit more on the upper side and reduce the accessibility to the masses. We loved every bite, bit it was still slightly overpriced
A nice restaurant, a little rustic with a modern twist I would say. I've only had good meals here, their alfredo sauce is amazing. Save room for tremendous desserts.
Excellent food! Nice setting, comfortable seating. The wait staff was friendly and helpful. Menu choices were varied and interesting and priced as expected for the area.

name: La Carreta
address: 5790 MacCorkle Ave SE, Charleston, WV 25304, USA
reviews: Nice, friendly service. Food comes quick. Very affordable.

I've been here several times and the staff are friendly and the food is amazing. The prices are fair and I usually like everything I order. The service during rush hour can be slow but it is worth the wait 😊
Good food and place to leisurely dine with family and friends. The chips and salsa flow and you're never rushed. The staff has always been friendly and attentive.
Always good food excellent service
Delicious food.. Fast  and friendly service

name: Fusion Teriyaki Grille
address: 4002 MacCorkle Ave SE, Charleston, WV 25304, USA
reviews: This place is amazing. Chicken teriyaki is to die for! Friendly staff! Great management!
Always friendly, always fast. I love the steak bowl, the pork bowl, the Gyoza is pretty awesome too!
Sell bad food got food poisoning from them and they denied everything. It's the only food I ate the entire day....
Fresh high quality food prepared in a healthy manner. Delicious.
Low quality, burnt food at a high price. Go to chow thai instead.

name: Cracker Barrel Old Country Store
address: 5720 MacCorkle Ave SE, Charleston, WV 25304, USA
reviews: Piping hot coffee. Great biscuits and gravy! Friendly staff and clean. Had breakfast "fireside" by the fireplace, it was a bonus on a chilly morning.

Went for a family meal, I had the country fried chicken and it was fried to perfection. It came with 2 thick, juicy, and so tender that it could be cut with a fork. Wife had roast beef, and was very pleased. Kids had a couple of the chicken tenderloin that was very good. One in our party had the grilled chicken salad, and it was huge, and very fresh.
Great food, beautiful memorabilia from old America

I honestly have never had a bad time here. The wait staff are always great, polite, and help as much as possible. They have giant checkers to play, a big fireplace thats amazing especially in the winter, and is just a comfortable place to eat. Their food is amazing in my opinion. My mother loves their chicken livers and the cheese casserole. Definitely give it a try. Also, the gift shop is amazing and unique. Older/replica antique things, toys, clothes, soaps and lotions, candy and sodas, and a lot of things you dont really see anywhere else. A little expensive in the gift shop, but very nice. I could spend a lot of money there. I wish they had the candy "Brown Cows" again. Great place to go and take your family for a nice country meal. I love it and highly recommend. Keep up the great work!

Very good food. Grilled chicken was very delicious and could be cut with a fork. Baked sweet potato was excellent, the skin peeled off very well and did not have any of the sweet potato stuck to the skin. I asked for the brown sugar and butter to be placed on the side, since I was not sure I wanted the butter or brown sugar. Steamed broccoli was good as well. The salad was delicious and fresh. The server was friendly and attentive.

name: Gonzoburger
address: 207 W Washington St, Charleston, WV 25302, USA
reviews: I've never been there before, until today. Was greeted by a friendly face. The place looks neat. Food was AWESOME but a little pricey, but the quality offsets that in my opinion. Definitely coming back. Would recommend!

Great atmosphere is the first thing that hits you when you walk in. Not sure what it previously was but they have left most of the original look and it's really nice. My server, Sid, was awesome and we talked quite a bit while I was there at the bar. I got the Patty Melt burger and it was delicious. Cooked just right and that marble rye made everything else pop. The menu all looked delicious and I can't wait to go back to try more. Parking was a little sad since it's mainly street parking with meters, unless there's a free lot I didn't see nearby. Overall I would highly recommend it.

Atmosphere is really cool and unique with all of the paintings everywhere. The food was really good! I liked that they decorate the tables with paper and have crayons to doodle while you wait. Fun place! Also impressed that the waitress wyrite her name upside down.

Gonzo burger is a wonderful dining experience: Delicious food, rare beer selection, super clean, the staff are excellent, and the art pieces in the restaurant that you can also buy are beautiful. If you are ever in Charleston, WV I highly recommend you check it out!!!

Second time here. Would have been 5 starts but the service was a little slow but not horribly  slow and my wife’s burger a little undercooked but again not horribly. Great atmosphere, parking is scarce so bring quarters for the meter. Food is really good, they blend their own burger in House we was told and it shows in the taste of the burger. Beer selection is above average and the soda comes in bottles, which I find a little weird but I’m sure they have a reason. Second time visiting and will be back. They sometime have live music which is really nice. Happy hour 4pm-6pm. Prices vary 10-13$ for a burger. Building is a historical building, so if you appreciate the architecture of old buildings and a good burger give it a try!

name: Books and Brews
address: 222 W Washington St, Charleston, WV 25302, USA
reviews: I can't think of anything that I have experienced in coming here that is negative. From the staff to the food to the drink selection everything has been a positive experience. The location is great, the atmosphere inside is exactly what it needs to be and it's perfect, and it's so small but I can always jam out to what's on the radio. 10/10 would recommend

My fiance and I visited B&B when it was in St. Albans, and although I miss the relaxed vibe of a lovely cup of coffee, board games and books, the new location is just as enjoyable in a different way. We felt energized and were greeted warmly from the first step in the door. We felt especially welcomed when a lovely gentleman by the name of Danny covered our tab!  All in all, 10/10 recommend this great place. Oh, and their pepperoni rolls re absolutely divine!!!
Try the pepperoni rolls.   You won't be disappointed.   My husband said the Reuben sandwich was one of the best he's ever had.   The wings and side salad were great too.  We will definitely be back.

Nice vibe! No dessert though. 🙁 Server did recommend going to a little place around the corner. Great Pepperoni Rolls Appetizer. More like a meal. A spin off of a traditional roll. Great Craft Beer selection. Server was nice, friendly. Worth trip to Westside/Elk City.

One of my favorite restaurants in Charleston, West Virginia. An Amazing selection of freshly prepared delicious food. A wonderful selection of freshly brewed coffee’s. On top of that a great selection of American and imported beers and wines. This great restaurant also occupies an amazing space. Come see the incredible restoration of the historic architecture of this beautiful Elk City building. Come enjoy the food and the wonderful ambiance of Books and Brews in Elk City.

name: Harding's Family Restaurant
reviews: Friendly. Clean. I am still getting used to food uo here. Got the side dish dinner, or the vegetable plate as we call it down South. Food comes, looks great. And tasted exactly like veggies with no salt or pepper or butter added while cooking. I admit I added some of each to what was appropriate. Now, the blueberry pie!!! That was wonderful!! I will probably go back when I am here for work. Just have to being some garlic!

They generally don’t allow you to swap a daily special soup and sandwich for non-meat options if it’s not the ‘daily special’.  But the manager allowed the swap after I explained my food restrictions.  (Tomato soup and grilled cheese).  Great service.  Great food.
I will always love stopping here! I highly recommend coming here like I can't recommend it enough! Food and staff are awesome, it's my favorite place to stop at. It was my first meal of 2020!

Worst meal I have had there, had grilled chicken, it looked boiled and there was Absolutely NO SEASONING, the broccoli they don't use a melted creamy cheese they put shredded salad cheese on it and the broccoli was supposed to be steamed but was more raw. Husband got chopped steak and it was dried out and had no seasoning. We are not the only ones complaining that day several other families complained and some left without eating.
Home cooked and tasty food at a very reasonable price, make sure you try the wilted salad and the homemade Graham cracker pie, it was excellent!! Yes I will be back.

name: The Corner Kitchen wv
reviews: Awesome food! Fabulous service! A must try if you live in the area or just visiting! The delivery convenient but I recommend going in to sit down for a meal. There is always wonderful people to have a conversation with!! The atmosphere at The Corner Kitchen is something you just can't find anywhere!!

I thought the other reviews were exaggerating. They weren't. It's exactly like I walked into someone's home. The whole family was there. Super friendly and casual vibe. Very affordable, but without cutting the quality. My brother and I both got grilled chicken sandwich at the advice of a staff member and was not disappointed. The brownies and PB fudge were on point, too. Considering this place is a block off the interstate, it is certainly worth the stop if you're even just driving by.

My first visit to the Corner Kitchen and I was very impressed. Friendly, down home restaurant that did not disappoint. Seriously, home cooked meals!! It’s like going to Grandma’s house on Sunday. Haven’t been to a restaurant in years that really has home cooked meals, though others advertise they do. Enjoyed talking with owners & staff. Meal was delicious and prices just could not be better. I dined in but also got a meal to go for tomorrow night. Highly recommend!!!
Great food.   An fast service
Food was great, was out of the kitchen quickly. The Pineapple Upside Down Cake was awesome.

name: Osaka Japanese Steakhouse
reviews: This new Japanese Steakhouse is probably the best place to eat in this area.  I stopped in for dinner by myself on a business trip.  I watched my ribeye cook over a special charcoal grill with wood imported from Japan.  VERY authentic with no expense or effort spared.  This is a top notch place, super clean with a experienced staff.  The menu variety has everything from chops and ribs to sushi and of course...Hibachi!  Can’t wait to go back. Would’ve been nice to have warm sake but they’re so new that they haven’t received their license yet.  Please get it soon!!
A great dining experience. The food was wonderful, very large portions and so tasty. The young lady who served us could not have taken any better care of us.
Phenomenal experience. Wonderful food, very friendly staff, and tremendous atmosphere. I will definitely be back!

The restaurant needed more time before opening. The hibachi area is a bit unfinished with uncomfortable chairs and heavily scratched walls. It took 45 minutes to seat us, 15 to get a server, another 15 for drinks, and then got our chef an hour later. However, the food was delectable, and the staff incredibly friendly. Hopefully they get some issues sorted improve!

The lobster and surf & turf sushi rolls are amazing, but the side of rice and noodles are very bland, maby the hibachi table versions are better. The mochi ice cream was nice as well. Staff seam friendly.

name: Fuji's | Sushi & Teriyaki
address: 1113 Jefferson Rd, South Charleston, WV 25309, USA
reviews: Fresh fresh fresh!!!  Authentic sushi and the actual blue crab used. Try Blue Fuji!!!
I love this man, He will make you feel welcome and feed you the best home made Japanese food you have ever tasted
Very good totally recommend trying
Best sushi in the charleston area
Hidden gem. If your grandpa was Japanese, this is how he would make sushi. Simple, not fancy, but done right. Family owned little shop that serves great food.

name: Husson's Pizza - Bridge Road
reviews: John is the best guy there. Props to his awesome skills with making food. Always pleased with my orders.

Sometimes I like a thin crust, Husson's has a good one. If you are very hungry, order a size or 2 larger than you would from a different pizzeria. Meats and vegetables always have good flavors and taste fresh!
We had a birthday party here at The Gathering Place. Very reasonable prices and so convenient to be able to get the pizza too. The space is on the small side but it worked perfectly for us.
The thin crust is a pretty delightful option
Best gluten free pizza in the valley

name: China Max
address: 3017 Charleston Town Center, Charleston, WV 25389, USA
reviews: Absolutely love the food and they give you nice portions. Spicy Chicken & Bourbon Chicken with Fried Rice is my favorite. I recommend this China Max if your ever at the Town Center Mall
Chinese restaurant in the Charleston town center that has the best bourbon chicken I've eaten and more for your money.
They won't answer the phone and obviously hours are wrong
Good food, large portions. Their honey chicken is my favorite! If you get egg rolls get the yumyum sause to dip it in!
Very friendly and courteous. Tasty and large portions for a great price.

name: Tudor's Biscuit World
address: 1506 Washington St E, Charleston, WV 25305, USA
reviews: The foods good. And most of the staff are great. I would have gave it 4 stars but they are kinda slow getting the food out even when they aren't busy and tye biscuits are really hard unfortunately

A step up for fast food and less expensive than national chains. The biscuits are home made and the country has is savory sand rich. Skip McDonalds and Burger King. For a taste of down home country fast food, come here instead.

It was a reasonable experience, but overpriced for what it was I thought. Mcdonalds beats biscuit world - also biscuit world is a bit of a strange name for a fast food restaurant, maybe that's just my British understanding not getting it...
wrong.I do like the food and drink but I think one times , mgt. failed to give me Senior discount!
Food was average. Miss the friendly and helpful staff they use to have. It's a shame that the place isn't kept like old times. Clean it up and smile people!
